<P class="p282 ft3">2. In the event that an additional State ratifies or accedes to the Treaty in accordance with the provisions of Article XVII and Article X, paragraph 4, subparagraph (C), and taking into account Article X, paragraph 4, subparagraph (D), an allocation of passive quotas to such a State shall be considered during the regular session of the Open Skies Consultative Commission following the date of deposit of its instrument of ratification or accession.</P>
<P class="p6 ft3">SECTION II. FIRST DISTRIBUTION OF ACTIVE QUOTAS FOR</P>
<P class="p227 ft3">OBSERVATION FLIGHTS</P>
<P class="p193 ft3">1. The first distribution of active quotas pursuant to Article III, Section I, paragraph 6 of the Treaty shall be such that each State Party shall be obliged to accept over its territory a number of observation flights no greater than 75 per cent, rounded down to the nearest whole number, of the individual passive quota allocated as set forth in Section I, paragraph 1 of this Annex. On this basis, and for those States Parties which have conducted negotiations in the framework of the Open Skies Conference in Vienna, the first distribution in respect of each other shall be valid from the date of entry into force of the Treaty until 31 December following the year during which the Treaty has entered into force and shall be effective only for those States Parties having ratified the Treaty. This first distribution is set forth as follows:</P>
<P class="p283 ft3">The Federal Republic of Germany shall have the right to conduct three observation flights over the territory of the Republic of Belarus and the Russian Federation group of States Parties, and one observation flight over the territory of Ukraine;</P>
<P class="p22 ft3">The United States of America shall have the right to conduct eight observation flights over the territory of the Republic of Belarus and the Russian Federation group of States Parties, and one observation flight, shared with Canada, over the territory of Ukraine;</P>
<P class="p48 ft3">The Republic of Belarus and the Russian Federation group of States Parties shall have the right to conduct two observation flights over the territory of Benelux, as referred to in Article XIV of the Treaty, two observation flights over the territory of Canada, two observation flights over the territory of the Kingdom of Denmark, three observation flights over the territory of the French Republic, three observation flights over the territory of the Federal Republic of Germany, one observation flight over the territory of the Hellenic Republic, two observation flights over</P>
<P class="p49 ft3">the territory of the Italian Republic, two observation flights over the terri-</P>
<P class="p215 ft3">68</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_69">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p284 ft3">tory of the Kingdom of Norway, two observation flights over the territory of the Republic of Turkey, three observation flights over the territory of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, and four observation flights over the territory of the United States of America;</P>
<P class="p72 ft3">The Kingdom of Belgium, the Grand Duchy of Luxembourg and the Kingdom of the Netherlands, referred to as the Benelux, shall have the right to conduct one observation flight over the territory of the Republic of Belarus and the Russian Federation group of States Parties, and one observation flight over the territory of the Republic of Poland;</P>
<P class="p285 ft3">The Republic of Bulgaria shall have the right to conduct one observation flight over the territory of the Hellenic Republic, one observation flight over the territory of the Italian Republic, and one observation flight over the territory of the Republic of Turkey;</P>
<P class="p286 ft3">Canada shall have the right to conduct two observation flights over the territory of the Republic of Belarus and the Russian Federation group of States Parties, one observation flight over the territory of the Czech and Slovak Federal Republic, one observation flight over the territory of the Republic of Poland, and one observation flight, shared with the United States of America, over the territory of Ukraine;</P>
<P class="p72 ft3">The Kingdom of Denmark shall have the right to conduct one observation flight over the territory of the Republic of Belarus and the Russian Federation group of States Parties, and one observation flight over the territory of the Republic of Poland;</P>
<P class="p72 ft14">The Kingdom of Spain shall have the right to conduct one observation flight over the territory of the Czech and Slovak Federal Republic;</P>
<P class="p72 ft3">The French Republic shall have the right to conduct three observation flights over the territory of the Republic of Belarus and the Russian Fe- deration group of States Parties, and one observation flight over the territory of Romania;</P>
<P class="p72 ft3">The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland shall have the right to conduct three observation flights over the territory of the Re- public of Belarus and the Russian Federation group of States Parties, and one observation flight over the territory of Ukraine;</P>
<P class="p72 ft14">The Hellenic Republic shall have the right to conduct one observation flight over the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria, and one observation flight over the territory of Romania;</P>
<P class="p72 ft3">The Republic of Hungary shall have the right to conduct one observation flight over the territory of Romania, and one observation flight over the territory of Ukraine;</P>
<P class="p72 ft3">The Italian Republic shall have the right to conduct two observation flights over the territory of the Republic of Belarus and the Russian Fe- deration group of States Parties, one observation flight over the territory of the Republic of Hungary, and one observation flight, shared with the Republic of Turkey, over the territory of Ukraine;</P>
<P class="p72 ft3">The Kingdom of Norway shall have the right to conduct two observation flights over the territory of the Republic of Belarus and the Russian Federation group of States Parties and one observation flight over the territory of the Republic of Poland;</P>
<P class="p31 ft31">The Republic of Poland shall have the right to conduct one observation flight over the territory of the Federal Republic of Germany, one observation flight over the territory of the Republic of Belarus and the Russian</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p73 ft3">Prop. 2001/02:157</P>

	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>

</TABLE>
<P class="p61 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Following this first distribution and until the date of full implementation of the Treaty specified in Article XVIII to that effect for the use of active quotas, annual distributions shall be based on the 75 per cent rule established in paragraph 1 of this Section in relation to the allocation of individual passive quotas.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p61 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">From the date of full implementation of the Treaty each State Party shall accept during subsequent distributions of active quotas over its territory, if so requested, a number of observation flights up to the full amount of its individual passive quota. Whenever possible or requested and unless otherwise agreed, those distributions shall be based on a proportionate increase of the active quotas distributed in the first distribution.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p61 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">In the event that an additional State ratifies or accedes to the Treaty in accordance with the provisions of Article XVII, the distribution of active quotas to such State shall be considered during the regular session of the Open Skies Consultative Commission following the date of the deposit of its instrument of ratification or accession, subject to the following provisions:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">the ratifying or acceding State shall have the right to request observation flights over the territories of States Parties within the passive quota allocated to that State in accordance with the provisions of Section I, paragraph 3 of this Annex, and within the passive quotas of the States Parties requested for observation flights, unless otherwise agreed by the States Parties involved; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p288 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft46">all States Parties shall have at the same time the right to request observation flights over the territory of that signing or acceding State within their active quotas and within the passive quota allocated to that State.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p289 ft3">70</P>
</DIV>

<DIV id="page_73">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p296 ft24">ANNEX B</P>
<P class="p258 ft72">INFORMATION ON SENSORS</P>
<P class="p297 ft3">SECTION I. TECHNICAL INFORMATION</P>
<P class="p246 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">Pursuant to Article IV, paragraph 10, each State Party shall inform all other States Parties of the applicable technical information listed in this Section on each sensor installed on the observation aircraft designated by that State Party pursuant to Article V of the Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft48">The following technical information shall be provided for optical panoramic and framing cameras:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">type and model;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p181 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">field of view along and across the flight path, or scan angles, in degrees;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">frame size, in millimetres by millimetres;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">exposure times, in seconds;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">types and colours of optical filters used and their filter factor;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(F)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">for each lens:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">name;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">focal length, in millimetres;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">maximum relative aperture of the lens;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p240 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">resolving power at a contrast ratio of 1000 to 1 or the equivalent modulation of 1.0, at the maximum relative aperture, in lines per millimetre;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p180 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(G)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">minimum and maximum photographic time intervals, in seconds, or cycle rates, in frames per second, if applicable;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(H)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">maximum velocity over height ratio, if applicable;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p181 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(I)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">for optical framing cameras, the maximum angle measured from the horizontal, or the minimum angle measured from the vertical, in degrees; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(J)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft66">maximum altitude for operation in metres, if applicable.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p298 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The following technical information shall be provided for video cameras:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">type and model;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">field of view, along and across the flight path, in degrees;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">for the lens:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">focal length, in millimetres;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">maximum relative aperture;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p240 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">resolving power at a contrast ratio of 1000 to 1 or the equivalent modulation of 1.0, at the maximum relative aperture, in lines per millimetre;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p181 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">detector element size, in micrometres, or equivalent information on the tube;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">number of detector elements;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p181 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(F)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">system light sensitivity, in lux or watts per square centimetre; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(G)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">spectral bandwidth, in nanometres.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft41">The following technical information shall be provided for infrared </SPAN><NOBR>line-scanning</NOBR> devices:</P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">type and model;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p299 ft3">(B) field of view or scan angles, in degrees;</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p12 ft3">Prop. 2001/02:157</P>
<P class="p12 ft3">Bilaga 6</P>
<P class="p118 ft3">73</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_74">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t11">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td35"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">(C) minimum instantaneous field of view, along and across the</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td35"><SPAN class="p173 ft3">flight path, in milliradians;</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">spectral bandwidth, in micrometres;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">minimum resolvable temperature difference, in degrees Celsius;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(F)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">temperature of detector during operation, in degrees Celsius;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(G)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">time required from </SPAN><NOBR>switch-on</NOBR> for the system to start up and cool down to its normal operating temperature, in minutes;</P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(H)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">maximum operating time, if applicable;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(I)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">maximum velocity over height ratio; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(J)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft66">maximum altitude for operation in metres, if applicable.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The following technical information shall be provided for sidewayslooking synthetic aperture radar:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">type and model;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft46">radar frequency bands, and specific operating frequency, in megahertz;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">polarisations;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">number of radar pulses, per metre or second;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">near range angular limit of operation, in degrees from vertical;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(F)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">swath width, in kilometres;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(G)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">ground resolution in range and azimuth, in the slant plane, in metres;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(H)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">maximum altitude for operation in metres, if applicable; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(I)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">transmitter output power, in watts.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">The following technical information shall be provided for sensors that record data on photographic film:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">the types of film that may be used with each sensor;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">width of film, in millimetres;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft46">film resolution at a contrast ratio of 1000 to 1 or the equivalent modulation of 1.0, in lines per millimetre; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">capacity of magazine for each type of film, in metres.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">The following technical information shall be provided for sensors that record data on other recording media:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">type and model of the data recording equipment;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">type and format of data recording media;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">bandwidth, in hertz, if applicable;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">data recording rate, in megabits per second, if applicable;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">capacity of recording media, in minutes or megabits; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(F)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">format for storage of data collected by sensors and data annotation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p300 ft3">SECTION II. ANNOTATION OF DATA</P>
<P class="p193 ft3">1. The following items of information shall be annotated on data collected by sensors during an observation period on the leader of each roll of the original film negative or at the beginning of each other recording medium in accordance with the provisions of Appendix 1 to this Annex:</P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">observation flight reference number;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p301 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">date of observation flight;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">sensor description;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft69"><SPAN class="ft69">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft74">sensor configuration; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p215 ft3">74</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_75">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">focal length, if applicable.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">The following items of information shall be recorded manually or electronically from the navigation and avionics systems of the observation aircraft and annotated on data collected by sensors during an observation period in a manner that does not obscure detail, in accordance with the provisions of Appendix 1 to this Annex:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">for optical cameras:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p240 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">at the start of the observation period and at any intermediate location during the observation period where there is a significant change of height above ground level, heading or groundspeed, and at intervals to be determined by the Open Skies Consultative Commission within the period of provisional application:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p302 ft3">(a) height above ground level;</P>
<P class="p239 ft3">(b) location;</P>
<P class="p239 ft3">(c) true heading; and</P>
<P class="p239 ft3">(d) scan angle;</P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">on every frame of photographic film:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">frame number;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p303 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">time; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">roll angle;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p201 ft5"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft60">for video cameras and </SPAN><NOBR>infra-red</NOBR> <NOBR>line-scanning</NOBR> devices, at the start of the observation period and at any intermediate location during the observation period where there is a significant change of height above ground level, heading or groundspeed, and at intervals to be determined by the Open Skies Consultative Commission within the period of provisional application:</P>
<P class="p239 ft3">(1) date and time;</P>
<P class="p239 ft3">(2) height above ground level;</P>
<P class="p239 ft3">(3) location;</P>
<P class="p239 ft3">(4) true heading; and</P>
<P class="p302 ft3">(5) scan angle;</P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">for </SPAN><NOBR>sideways-looking</NOBR> synthetic aperture radar:</P>
<P class="p240 ft3">(1) at the start of the observation period and at any intermediate location during the observation period where there is a significant change of height above ground level, heading or groundspeed, and at intervals to be determined by the Open Skies Consultative Commission within the period of provisional application:</P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">date and time;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">height above ground level;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">location;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">true heading;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p303 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">look down angle to the nearest point of the swath width;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p303 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(f)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">swath width; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(g)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">polarisations;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p217 ft14">(2) each time they are measured in order to ensure correct processing of the image:</P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(a)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">groundspeed;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">drift;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">pitch angle; and</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p12 ft3">Prop. 2001/02:157</P>
<P class="p12 ft3">Bilaga 6</P>
<P class="p118 ft3">75</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_76">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p304 ft3">(d) roll angle.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">3. For copies of single frames or strips of imagery produced from the</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft5">original film negative or other recording media, the items of information</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>

	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>

	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>

<P class="p305 ft24">APPENDIX 1 TO ANNEX B</P>
<P class="p306 ft56">ANNOTATION OF DATA COLLECTED DURING AN</P>
<P class="p307 ft56">OBSERVATION FLIGHT</P>
<P class="p178 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft44">The reference number of the observation flight shall be indicated by a single group of six alphanumeric characters in accordance with the following convention:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">the letters "OS";</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">the last digit of the calendar year for which the individual active quota applies; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">a </SPAN><NOBR>three-digit</NOBR> number to represent each individual observation flight comprising the active quota distributed during the annual review within the framework of the Open Skies Consultative Commission for a calendar year to a State Party over the territory of another State Party.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The sensor description shall be indicated by a single block of up to six alphanumeric characters comprising two groups in accordance with the following convention:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">a group of up to four characters to represent the category of the sensor in accordance with the following convention:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p308 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">"OP" - optical panoramic camera;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p308 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">"OF" - optical framing camera;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p308 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">"TV" - video camera;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p308 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">"IRLS" - </SPAN><NOBR>infra-red</NOBR> <NOBR>line-scanning</NOBR> device; or</P>
<P class="p308 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(5)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">"SAR" – </SPAN><NOBR>sideways-looking</NOBR> synthetic aperture radar;</P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">a group of two characters to represent the type of the recording medium in accordance with the following convention:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p308 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">"BI" - black and white, </SPAN><NOBR>iso-panchromatic;</NOBR></P>
<P class="p308 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">"BM" - black and white, monochromatic;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p308 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">"BP" - black and white, panchromatic;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p308 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">"BR" - black and white, reversal;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p309 ft14">(5)"TA" - tape, analogue; or (6)"TD" - tape, digital.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3">3. The sensor configuration shall be indicated by a single block of up to nine alphanumeric characters comprising three groups in accordance with the following convention:</P>
<P class="p174 ft10"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft71">a group of four alphanumeric characters to represent the installation of the sensor on the observation aircraft either as:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p68 ft3">76</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_77">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p240 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">an internal installation, which shall be denoted by the code "INT", followed by a number to indicate the relative location of the installation of the sensor on the observation aircraft in sequence from nose to tail of the observation aircraft; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p240 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft41">a podded installation, which shall be denoted by the code "POD", followed by one of the following three letters:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3">(a) "L" - mounted under left wing;</P>
<P class="p239 ft3">(b) "R" - mounted under right wing; or</P>
<P class="p239 ft3">(c) "C" - mounted on the aircraft centre line;</P>
<P class="p201 ft31"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft75">a group of up to three alphanumeric characters to represent the type of installation in accordance with the following convention:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p240 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">a vertical installation in which the sensor is not tilted more than five degrees from the vertical shall be denoted by the letter "V";</SPAN></P>
<P class="p240 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">an oblique installation in which the sensor is tilted more than five degrees from the vertical shall be denoted by one of the following two letters, followed by the depression angle in degrees:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p239 ft3">(a) "L" - left pointing;</P>
<P class="p239 ft3">(b) "R" - right pointing;</P>
<P class="p240 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft44">a fan installation of two or more sensors shall be denoted by the letter "F";</SPAN></P>
<P class="p181 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">for a fan installation, a group of up to two numbers to indicate the number and position of the sensors as follows:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p240 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">the first number to indicate the total number of sensors in that installation; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p240 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">the second number to indicate the individual sensor position, in sequence from left to right relative to the direction of flight of the observation aircraft.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p129 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">The focal length of a lens shall be provided in millimetres.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p310 ft14">5.The date and time shall be provided to the nearest minute of Co- ordinated Universal Time.</P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">The average height above ground level of the observation aircraft shall be denoted by a </SPAN><NOBR>five-digit</NOBR> number, followed by a code to represent the units of measurement in either feet, by the letter "F", or metres, by the letter "M".</P>
<P class="p164 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The latitude and longitude of the location of the observation aircraft shall be provided in degrees to the nearest </SPAN><NOBR>one-hundredth</NOBR> of a degree, in the format "dd.dd(N or S) ddd.dd(E or W)", or in degrees and minutes to the nearest minute, in the format "dd mm(N or S) ddd mm(E or W)".</P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The true heading of the observation aircraft shall be provided in degrees to the nearest degree.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">9.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The roll angle of the observation aircraft shall be provided in degrees followed by a code to indicate whether the roll is to the left, by the letter "L", or to the right, by the letter "R".</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">10.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The pitch angle of the observation aircraft shall be provided in degrees followed by a code to indicate whether the pitch is up, by the letter "U", or down, by the letter "D", relative to the horizontal.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p164 ft77"><SPAN class="ft5">11.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft76">The drift angle of the observation aircraft shall be provided in degrees followed by a code to indicate whether the drift is to the left, by the</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p12 ft3">Prop. 2001/02:157</P>
<P class="p12 ft3">Bilaga 6</P>
<P class="p118 ft3">77</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_78">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">letter "L", or to the right, by the letter "R", relative to the flight path of</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">the observation aircraft.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">12.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The groundspeed of the observation aircraft shall be denoted by a </SPAN><NOBR>three-digit</NOBR> number followed by a <NOBR>two-letter</NOBR> code to indicate the units of measurement in either nautical miles, by the letters "NM", or kilometres, by the letters "KM", per hour.</P>
<P class="p88 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">13.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The nearest point of the swath width shall be provided in kilome-</SPAN></P>
<P class="p311 ft3">tres.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">14.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The look down angle shall be provided in degrees measured from the vertical.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p88 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">15.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">The swath width shall be provided in kilometres.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">16.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">For photographic film, each magazine used during an observation flight from the same sensor shall be numbered in sequence starting from one. Each frame on the original film negative exposed by each sensor shall be individually numbered in sequence, from the first frame to the last frame of that magazine of that sensor. In each case when the film is numbered using one or two numbers per frame, a single frame shall be defined without ambiguity by specifying either the number closest to the centre of the frame, or, in the event that the numbers are equidistant from the centre, the smaller whole number.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p312 ft24">ANNEX C</P>
<P class="p313 ft56">INFORMATION ON OBSERVATION AIRCRAFT</P>
<P class="p276 ft14">Pursuant to the provisions of Article V, paragraph 2 of the Treaty, States Parties, when designating aircraft as observation aircraft, shall notify all other States Parties of the information specified below.</P>
<P class="p88 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">Identification:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">type and model; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">number, category, type and configuration of each sensor installed on the observation aircraft, as provided in accordance with the provisions of Annex B to the Treaty;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p88 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">Mission Planning:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">for each type and configuration of sensor installed on the observation aircraft:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p314 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">for which ground resolution is dependent upon height above ground level, the height above ground level in metres at which that sensor achieves the ground resolution for that category of sensor specified in Article IV, paragraph 2 of the Treaty;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p314 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft41">for which ground resolution is not dependent upon height above ground level, the altitude for maximum range;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">optimum cruising speed in kilometres per hour at each altitude specified in accordance with subparagraph (A) of this paragraph;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p247 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">fuel consumption in kilograms per hour at optimum cruising speed at each altitude specified in accordance with subparagraph</SPAN></P>
<P class="p308 ft3">(A) of this paragraph.</P>
<P class="p88 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">Navigation, Communications and Landing Aids:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p315 ft3">78</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_79">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t18">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td35"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">(A) each type of navigation equipment installed on the observation</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td35"><SPAN class="p173 ft3">aircraft, including its positional accuracy, in metres; and</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p204 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">radio communications, approach and landing aid equipment installed on the observation aircraft, in accordance with standard ICAO practice.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p129 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">Ground Handling:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p204 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">length, wingspan, maximum height, wheel base, and turning radius;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">maximum </SPAN><NOBR>take-off</NOBR> weight and maximum landing weight;</P>
<P class="p204 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">airfield runway length and pavement strength required at maximum take off and landing weights, including any capability for landing on unpaved strips;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">types and capacities of fuel, oils, hydraulic fluid and oxygen;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">types of electrical servicing and starting units; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(F)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">any special requirements.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p129 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">Accommodation facilities:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">number of flight crew;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">number of sensor operators;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p204 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft46">number of flight representatives, flight monitors or representatives who could be seated on board; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">sleeping berths.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p316 ft24">ANNEX D</P>
<P class="p297 ft56">CERTIFICATION OF OBSERVATION AIRCRAFT AND SENSORS</P>
<P class="p116 ft3">SECTION I. GENERAL PROVISIONS</P>
<P class="p317 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">Each State Party shall have the right to participate in the certification of an observation aircraft of each type and model and its associated set of sensors designated by another State Party pursuant to Article V of the Treaty, during which the observation aircraft and its sensors shall be examined both on the ground and in flight.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p238 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">Each certification shall be conducted in order to establish:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p204 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">that the aircraft is of a type and model designated pursuant to Article V of the Treaty;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p204 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">that the sensors installed on the observation aircraft are of a category specified in Article IV, paragraph 1 of the Treaty and satisfy the requirements specified in Article IV, paragraph 2 of the Treaty;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p204 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">that the technical information has been provided in accordance with the provisions of Annex B, Section I to the Treaty;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p207 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">in the event that the ground resolution of a sensor is dependent upon height above ground level, the minimum height above ground level from which each such sensor installed on an observation aircraft of that type and model may be operated during an observation flight, pursuant to the limitation on ground resolution specified in Article IV, paragraph 2 of the Treaty;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p204 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft44">in the event that the ground resolution is not dependent upon height above ground level, the ground resolution of each such</SPAN></P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t19">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr8 td47"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">sensor installed on an observation aircraft of that type and mo-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr12 td37"><SPAN class="p13 ft3">79</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td47"><SPAN class="p3 ft33">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_80">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p217 ft14">del, pursuant to the limitation on ground resolution specified in Article IV, paragraph 2 of the Treaty; and</P>
<P class="p201 ft5"><SPAN class="ft3">(F)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft57">that the covers for sensor apertures or other devices that inhibit the operation of sensors are in their proper position in accordance with the provisions of Article IV, paragraph 4 of the Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">Each State Party conducting a certification shall notify all other States Parties, no less than 60 days in advance, of the period of seven days during which the certification of that observation aircraft and its sensors will take place. Such notification shall specify:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p181 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">the State Party conducting the certification of the observation aircraft and its sensors;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p181 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft46">the point of entry at which personnel of the States Parties taking part in the certification should arrive;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">the location at which the certification is to be conducted;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">the dates on which the certification is to begin and end;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p318 ft3"><SPAN class="ft78">(</SPAN>E) the number, type and model of each observation aircraft to be certified; and</P>
<P class="p181 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(F)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">the type and model, description and configuration of each sensor installed on the observation aircraft to be certified, in accordance with the format specified in Annex B, Appendix 1 to the Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p164 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft8">No later than ten days after receipt of the notification pursuant to the provisions of paragraph 3 of this Section, each State Party shall notify all other States Parties of its intention to participate in the certification of such aircraft and its sensors pursuant to the provisions of Article IV, paragraph 11. The number of individuals that shall participate in the certification from amongst those States Parties that notified their intention to participate shall be decided upon within the Open Skies Consultative Commission. Unless otherwise agreed, the number of individuals shall total no more than 40 and include no more than four from any one State Party. In the event that two or more States Parties notify their intention to conduct a certification during the same period, it shall be decided within the Open Skies Consultative Commission which of them shall conduct the certification in this period.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p319 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft8">Each State Party taking part in the certification shall notify the State Party conducting the certification no less than 30 days prior to the date on which the certification of the observation aircraft is to begin, as notified in accordance with paragraph 3 of this Section, of the following:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p180 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">the names of the individuals taking part in the certification and, in the event that a </SPAN><NOBR>non-commercial</NOBR> transport aircraft is used to travel to the point of entry, a list of the names of the crew members, in each case specifying gender, date of birth, place of birth and passport number. All such individuals shall be on the list of individuals designated pursuant to Article XIII, Section I of the Treaty;</P>
<P class="p181 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft46">the date and the estimated time of arrival of such individuals at the point of entry; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">the mode of transport used to arrive at the point of entry.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">No less than 14 days prior to the date on which the certification of the observation aircraft is to begin, as notified in accordance with para-</SPAN></P>
<P class="p12 ft3">graph 3 of this Section, the State Party conducting the certification shall</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p12 ft3">Prop. 2001/02:157</P>
<P class="p12 ft3">Bilaga 6</P>
<P class="p118 ft3">80</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_81">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">provide the States Parties which are taking part in the certification with</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">the following information for each sensor installed on the observation</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">aircraft, and for associated equipment used for the annotation of data col-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>

<TR>
