	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">a description of each constituent part of the sensor, including its purpose, and any connection to associated equipment used for the annotation of data;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">photographs taken of each sensor separate from the observation aircraft, in accordance with the following specifications:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p314 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">each sensor shall fill at least 80 per cent of the photograph either horizontally or vertically;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p314 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">such photographs may be either colour or black and white and shall measure 18 centimetres by 24 centimetres, excluding the border; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p314 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">each photograph shall be annotated with the category of the sensor, its type and model, and the name of the State Party that is presenting the sensor for certification;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">instructions on the </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> operation of each sensor.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">In the event that no State Party notifies its intention to take part in the certification in accordance with the provisions of paragraph 5 of this Section, the State Party shall conduct by itself an </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination in accordance with the provisions of Section III of this Annex and complete a certification report in accordance with the provisions of Section IV of this Annex.</P>
<P class="p24 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The provisions of Article XIII, Section II of the Treaty shall apply to the personnel of each State Party taking part in the certification during the entire period of their stay on the territory of the State Party conducting the certification.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p24 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">9.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft49">The personnel of each State Party taking part in the certification shall leave the territory of the State Party conducting the certification promptly after signing the certification report.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p300 ft3">SECTION II. GROUND EXAMINATION</P>
<P class="p178 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft48">With the approval of the State Party conducting the certification, ground examinations by more than one State Party may be conducted simultaneously. States Parties shall have the right jointly to conduct a ground examination of the observation aircraft and its sensors. The State Party conducting the certification shall have the right to determine the number of personnel engaged at any one time in the ground examination of an observation aircraft and its sensors.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p48 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft41">Unless otherwise agreed, the ground examination shall not exceed three </SPAN><NOBR>eight-hour</NOBR> periods for each observation aircraft and its sensors.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft48">Prior to the commencement of the ground examination, the State Party conducting the certification shall provide the States Parties taking part in the certification with the following information:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">for optical panoramic and framing cameras:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft69"><SPAN class="ft63">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft79">the modulation transfer curve of the response of the lens to spatial frequency (frequency/contrast characteristic) at the maximum relative aperture of that lens, in lines per millimetre;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p134 ft3">81</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_82">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t13">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td12"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">(2) specifications of the black and white aerial film that will be</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td12"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">used to collect data during an observation flight, or for the dup-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td12"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">lication of such data, in accordance with the provisions of</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td12"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Annex K, Section I, paragraph 2 to the Treaty;</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p321 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">specifications of the film processors which will be used to develop original film negatives and duplicators that will be used to produce film positives or negatives, in accordance with the provisions of Annex K, Section I, paragraph 1 to the Treaty; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p321 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(4)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">flight test data showing ground resolution as a function of height above ground level for each type of aerial film that will be used with the optical camera;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">for video cameras, flight test data from all output devices showing ground resolution as a function of height above ground level;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">for </SPAN><NOBR>infra-red</NOBR> <NOBR>line-scanning</NOBR> devices, flight test data from all output devices showing ground resolution as a function of height above ground level; and</P>
<P class="p287 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">for </SPAN><NOBR>sideways-looking</NOBR> synthetic aperture radar, flight test data from all output devices showing ground resolution as a function of slant range from the aircraft.</P>
<P class="p61 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft48">Prior to the commencement of the ground examination, the State Party conducting the certification shall provide a briefing to the State Party or States Parties taking part in the certification on:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">its plan for the conduct of the ground examination of the observation aircraft and its sensors;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">the observation aircraft, as well as its sensors, associated equipment and covers for sensor apertures or other devices that inhibit the operation of sensors, indicating their location on the observation aircraft with the help of diagrams, photographs, slides and other visual materials;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">all necessary safety precautions that shall be observed during the ground examination of the observation aircraft and its sensors; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p287 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">the inventory procedures that escorts of the State Party conducting the certification intend to use pursuant to paragraph 6 of this Section.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p61 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">Prior to the commencement of the ground examination, each State Party taking part in the certification shall deliver to the State Party conducting the certification a list of each item of equipment to be used during the ground examination or </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination. The States Parties conducting the examination shall be permitted to take on board the observation aircraft and use video cameras, <NOBR>hand-held</NOBR> audio recorders and <NOBR>hand-held</NOBR> electronic computers. The States Parties taking part in the certification shall be permitted to use other items of equipment, subject to the approval of the State Party conducting the certification.</P>
<P class="p322 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft8">The States Parties taking part in the certification shall, together with the State Party conducting the certification, conduct an inventory of each item of equipment provided for in paragraph 5 of this Section, and review the inventory procedures which shall be followed to confirm that each item of equipment brought on board the observation aircraft by the States</SPAN></P>
<P class="p188 ft3">82</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_83">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p323 ft14">Parties taking part in the certification has been removed from the observation aircraft upon conclusion of the examination.</P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">Personnel of each State Party taking part in the certification shall have the right to conduct the following activities during the ground examination on the observation aircraft and of each sensor installed on the observation aircraft:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p201 ft5"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft80">confirm that the number and configuration of each sensor installed on the observation aircraft correspond to the information provided in accordance with the provisions of Section I, paragraph 6 of this Annex, Annex C and Annex B, Section I;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p181 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">familiarize themselves with the installation of each sensor on the observation aircraft, including the constituent parts thereof and their connections to each other and to any associated equipment used for the annotation of data;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p181 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft46">obtain a demonstration of the control and operation of each sensor; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p181 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">familiarize themselves with the flight test data provided in accordance with the provisions of paragraph 3 of this Section.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">At the request of any State Party taking part in the certification, the State Party conducting the certification shall photograph any sensor installed on the observation aircraft, the associated equipment on the observation aircraft, or the sensor apertures with their covers or devices which inhibit the operation of sensors. Such photographs shall fulfil the requirements specified in Section I, paragraph 6, subparagraphs (B)(1),</SPAN></P>
<P class="p284 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">and (3) of this Annex.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">9.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">The State Party conducting the certification shall have the right to designate personnel to accompany throughout the ground examination the personnel of the States Parties taking part in the certification to confirm compliance with the provisions of this Section. The personnel of the State Party conducting the certification shall not interfere with the activities of the States Parties taking part in the certification, unless such activities conflict with the safety precautions provided for in paragraph 4, subparagraph (C) of this Section.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">10.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">The State Party conducting the certification shall provide the States Parties taking part in the certification access to the entire observation aircraft, its sensors and associated equipment and sufficient power to operate its sensors and associated equipment. The State Party conducting the certification shall open such compartments or remove panels or barriers, to the extent necessary to permit examination of any sensor and associated equipment subject to certification.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p40 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">11.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft44">Notwithstanding the provisions of this Section, the ground examination shall be conducted in a manner that does not:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p181 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">degrade, damage, or prevent subsequent operation of the observation aircraft or its sensors;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p181 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">alter the electrical or mechanical structure of the observation aircraft or its sensors; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p206 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">impair the airworthiness of the observation aircraft.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">12.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">The States Parties taking part in the certification shall have the right to take measurements, and make notes, sketches, similar records and recordings using the items of equipment listed in paragraph 5 of this</SPAN></P>
<P class="p12 ft3">Section, relating to the observation aircraft, its sensors and their associa-</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p12 ft3">Prop. 2001/02:157</P>
<P class="p12 ft3">Bilaga 6</P>
<P class="p118 ft3">83</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_84">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">ted equipment. Such working materials may be retained by the State Par-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">ty taking part in the certification and shall not be subject to any review or</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">examination by the State Party conducting the certification.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">13.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">The State Party conducting the certification shall make every effort to answer questions of the States Parties taking part in the certification that pertain to the ground examination.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">14.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">Upon completion of the ground examination, the States Parties taking part in the certification shall leave the observation aircraft, and the State Party conducting the certification shall have the right to use its own inventory procedures set forth in accordance with paragraph 6 of this Section to confirm that all the equipment used during the ground examination in accordance with paragraph 5 of this Section has been removed from the observation aircraft.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p6 ft3">SECTION III. <NOBR>IN-FLIGHT</NOBR> EXAMINATION</P>
<P class="p178 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft41">In addition to conducting a ground examination of the observation aircraft and its sensors, the State Party conducting the certification shall conduct one in flight examination of its sensors which shall be sufficient to:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">permit observation of the operation of all the sensors installed on the observation aircraft;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">in the event that the ground resolution of a sensor is dependent upon height above ground level, establish the minimum height above ground level from which each such sensor installed on an observation aircraft of that type and model shall be operated for any observation flight, in accordance with the limitation on ground resolution specified in Article IV, paragraph 2 of the Treaty; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">in the event that the ground resolution of a sensor is not dependent upon height above ground level, establish the ground resolution of each such sensor installed on an observation aircraft of that type and model is in accordance with the limitation on ground resolution specified in Article IV, paragraph 2 of the Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Prior to the commencement of the </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination of the sensors, the State Party conducting the certification shall brief the States Parties participating in the certification on its plan for the conduct of the <NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination. This briefing shall include the following information:</P>
<P class="p174 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">a diagram of the calibration targets that it intends to use for the </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination in accordance with the provisions of Ap- pendix 1, Section I, paragraph 5 to this Annex;</P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">the estimated time, meteorological conditions, number, direction and height above ground level of each pass over the calibration target appropriate to each sensor to be certified; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p247 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft46">all necessary safety precautions that shall be observed during the </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination of the observation aircraft and its sensors.</P>
<P class="p85 ft81"><SPAN class="ft81">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft82">Prior to and during the conduct of the </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination, States Parties taking part in the certification shall have the right to visit the loca-</P>
<P class="p215 ft3">84</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_85">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">tion of the calibration targets. The State Party conducting the certification</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">shall provide such items of equipment as required to confirm that the</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">calibration targets meet the specifications set forth in Appendix 1, Sec-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">tion I to this Annex.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p85 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination shall be conducted during clear atmospheric daytime conditions, unless otherwise agreed, over the calibration targets appropriate to each category of sensor installed on the observation aircraft in accordance with the provisions of Appendix 1, Section II to this Annex, to determine the ground resolution of each sensor.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The State Party conducting the certification shall provide such data on the meteorological conditions at the location of the calibration targets during the </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination of the sensors as are necessary to make the calculations in accordance with the methodologies specified in Ap- pendix 1, Section III to this Annex.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Each State Party shall have the right to designate personnel to take part in the </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination. In the event that the number of individuals so designated exceeds the passenger capacity of the observation aircraft, the States Parties participating in the certification shall agree which of its personnel shall participate in the <NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination.</P>
<P class="p22 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft44">Personnel of the States Parties designated pursuant to paragraph 6 of this Section shall have the right to observe the operation of the sensors by personnel of the State Party conducting the certification.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft41">Personnel of the States Parties taking part in the certification shall have the right to monitor the unsealing of the film cassette and the storage, processing and handling of the original film negative exposed during the </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination, in accordance with the provisions of Annex K, Section II to the Treaty.</P>
<P class="p83 ft3">SECTION IV. CERTIFICATION REPORT</P>
<P class="p193 ft3">1. Upon completion of the ground and <NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examinations, data collected by sensors and from the calibration targets shall be examined jointly by the State Party conducting the certification and the States Parties taking part in the certification. These States Parties shall prepare a certification report which shall establish:</P>
<P class="p236 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">that the observation aircraft is of a type and model designated pursuant to Article V of the Treaty;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p247 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">that the sensors installed on the observation aircraft are of a category provided for in Article IV, paragraph 1 of the Treaty and satisfy the requirements of Article IV, paragraph 2 of the Treaty;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft46">that the technical information on sensors has been provided in accordance with Annex B, Section I to the Treaty;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">in the event that the ground resolution of a sensor is dependent upon height above ground level, the minimum height above ground level at which each such sensor on an observation aircraft of that type and model may be operated during an observation flight pursuant to the limitation on ground resolution specified in Article IV, paragraph 2 of the Treaty;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft69"><SPAN class="ft69">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft83">in the event that the ground resolution is not dependent upon height above ground level, the ground resolution of each such</SPAN></P>
<P class="p215 ft3">85</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_86">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t12">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td12"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">sensor installed on an observation aircraft of that type and mo-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td12"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">del, pursuant to the limitations on ground resolution specified in</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td12"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Article IV, paragraph 2 of the Treaty; and</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p204 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(F)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">that the covers for sensor apertures or other devices that inhibit the operation of sensors are in accordance with the provisions of Article IV, paragraph 4 of the Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p203 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">A copy of the information for each sensor provided pursuant to Section I, paragraph 6 and Section II, paragraphs 3 and 8 of this Annex shall be attached to the certification report.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p203 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">Copies of the certification report shall be provided to all other States Parties by the State Party conducting the certification. States Parties that did not take part in the certification shall not have the right to reject the conclusions contained in the certification report.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p203 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft48">An observation aircraft and its associated set of sensors shall be deemed to be certified unless the States Parties taking part in the certification are unable to reach agreement on the contents of the certification report.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p208 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft44">In the event that the State Party conducting the certification and States Parties taking part in the certification are unable to reach agreement on the contents of the certification report, the observation aircraft shall not be used for observation flights until the issue is resolved.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p324 ft24">APPENDIX 1 TO ANNEX D</P>
<P class="p325 ft56">METHODOLOGIES FOR THE VERIFICATION OF THE PERFORMANCE OF SENSORS INSTALLED ON AN OB- SERVATION AIRCRAFT</P>
<P class="p326 ft3">The ground resolution of each sensor installed on the observation aircraft, and, where its performance depends on height above ground level, the minimum height above ground level at which this sensor may be operated during an observation flight, shall be determined and confirmed on the basis of data collected over calibration targets appropriate to each category of sensor in accordance with the specifications in Section I and calculated in accordance with the methodologies to be determined within the Open Skies Consultative Commission.</P>
<P class="p327 ft3">SECTION I. SPECIFICATIONS FOR CALIBRATION TARGETS</P>
<P class="p328 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Calibration targets shall be provided by the State Party conducting the certification in accordance with the provisions of Annex D to the Treaty. Such calibration targets shall be used to establish the ground resolution of sensors, of a type appropriate to each sensor category, and designed in accordance with characteristics specified below.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p203 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Calibration targets for establishing the ground resolution of optical cameras shall consist of a series of groups of alternating black and white bars. Each group of bars shall consist of a minimum of two black bars separated by a white bar. The width of black and white bars within a group shall remain constant. The width of the bars in groups of bars in</SPAN></P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t9">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td36"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">the calibration target shall change in steps sufficient to ensure accurate</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr10 td37"><SPAN class="p13 ft3">86</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr28 td36"><SPAN class="p3 ft84">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_87">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p211 ft3">measurement of the ground resolution. The length of the bars shall remain constant within each group. The contrast ratio of the black to white bars shall be consistent throughout the target and shall be at least 5 to 1 (equivalent to a modulation of 0.66).</P>
<P class="p164 ft31"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft85">Calibration targets for establishing the ground resolution of </SPAN><NOBR>infra-red</NOBR> <NOBR>line-scanning</NOBR> devices shall be determined within the Open Skies Consultative Commission during the period of provisional application.</P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft48">Calibration targets for establishing the ground resolution of side- </SPAN><NOBR>ways-looking</NOBR> synthetic aperture radar shall consist of arrays of trihedral corner reflectors whose configuration shall be in accordance with the methodologies determined within the Open Skies Consultative Commission during the period of provisional application.</P>
<P class="p164 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft8">Each State Party shall provide all other States Parties with a diagram of the calibration targets that it intends to use for the purpose of </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination. Such diagrams shall be annotated with the overall dimensions of the calibration targets, their locations and the type of terrain on which they are deployed, as well as the information appropriate to each type of calibration target as determined within the Open Skies Consultative Commission during the period of provisional application.</P>
<P class="p329 ft3">SECTION II. CONDUCT OF IN FLIGHT EXAMINATION</P>
<P class="p157 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">In order to establish the ground resolution of panoramic or vertical- </SPAN><NOBR>ly-installed</NOBR> framing cameras, the line of flight of the observation aircraft shall be directly over and parallel to the calibration target. In order to establish the ground resolution of <NOBR>obliquely-installed</NOBR> framing cameras, the line of flight of the observation aircraft shall be parallel to the calibration target at a range such that the image of the calibration target appears in the foreground of the field of view of the optical camera set at its maximum angle measured from the horizontal or minimum angle measured from the vertical.</P>
<P class="p40 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft66">In order to establish the ground resolution of an </SPAN><NOBR>infra-red</NOBR> linescanning device, the line of flight of the observation aircraft shall be directly over and parallel to the calibration target at an agreed range of heights above ground level.</P>
<P class="p182 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft49">In order to establish the ground resolution of a </SPAN><NOBR>sideways-looking</NOBR> synthetic aperture radar, the line of flight of the observation aircraft shall be to the side of the array of the corner reflectors.</P>
<P class="p330 ft10">SECTION III. ANALYSIS OF DATA COLLECTED DURING THE <NOBR>IN-FLIGHT</NOBR> EXAMINATION</P>
<P class="p198 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Following the </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination, the State Party conducting the certification and the States Parties taking part in the certification shall jointly analyse the data collected during the <NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination pursuant to Annex D, Section IV, paragraph 1 to the Treaty.</P>
<P class="p41 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft44">The methodology for calculating the minimum height above ground level at which each optical camera installed on the observation aircraft may be operated during an observation flight, including the value of the</SPAN></P>
<P class="p12 ft3">contrast ratio or the equivalent modulation to be used in this calculation,</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p12 ft3">Prop. 2001/02:157</P>
<P class="p12 ft3">Bilaga 6</P>
<P class="p118 ft3">87</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_88">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">which shall be not less than 1.6:1 (correspondingly 0.23) and not greater</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">than 4:1 (correspondingly 0.6), shall be determined within the Open Ski-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">es Consultative Commission during the period of provisional application</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">and prior to 30 June 1992. The ground resolution of optical cameras shall</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">be determined from a visual analysis of the image of the calibration tar-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">get on the original film negative. The numerical value of ground resolu-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">tion shall be equal to the width of the smallest bar of the calibration tar-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">get that is distinguishable as a separate bar.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The methodology for calculating the minimum height above ground level at which each video camera installed on the observation aircraft may be operated during an observation flight shall be determined within the Open Skies Consultative Commission during the period of provisional application.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">The methodology for calculating the minimum height above ground level at which an </SPAN><NOBR>infra-red</NOBR> <NOBR>line-scanning</NOBR> device installed on the observation aircraft may be operated during an observation flight, including the value of the minimum resolvable temperature difference to be used in this calculation, shall be determined within the Open Skies Consultative Commission during the period of provisional application.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft48">The methodology for calculating the ground resolution of a side- </SPAN><NOBR>ways-looking</NOBR> synthetic aperture radar, including the determination of the relationship between the impulse response method and the object separation method, shall be determined within the Open Skies Consultative Commission during the period of provisional application.</P>
<P class="p312 ft24">ANNEX E</P>
<P class="p331 ft56">PROCEDURES FOR ARRIVALS AND DEPARTURES</P>
<P class="p332 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft57">Each State Party shall designate one or more points of entry, one or more points of exit, and one or more Open Skies airfields on its territory. Points of entry and points of exit may or may not be the same as the Open Skies airfields. Unless otherwise agreed, if an Open Skies airfield is different from a point of entry, the Open Skies airfield shall be designated so that the observing Party can reach the Open Skies airfield within five hours from the point of entry either in its own observation aircraft or in transportation provided by the observed Party. The observing Party, after arriving at a point of entry or an Open Skies airfield, shall have the right to a rest period, subject to the provisions of Article VI of the Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p333 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">Each State Party shall have the right to designate entry fixes and exit fixes. If a State Party elects to designate entry fixes and exit fixes, such fixes shall facilitate flight from the territory of the observing Party to the point of entry of the observed Party. Planned flights between entry fixes and points of entry and between points of exit and exit fixes shall be conducted in accordance with published ICAO standards and recommended practices and national regulations. In the event that portions of the flights between entry fixes and points of entry or between points of exit and exit fixes lie in international airspace, the flight through international airspace shall be conducted in accordance with published international regulations.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p334 ft3">88</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_89">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t20">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">3. Information on points of entry and points of exit, Open Skies airfi-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft5">elds, entry fixes and exit fixes, refuelling airfields, and calibration targets</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p335 ft5">shall initially be as specified in Appendix 1 to this Annex.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">A State Party shall have the right to introduce changes to Appendix 1 to this Annex by notifying all other States Parties of such changes, in writing, no less than 90 days before such changes become effective.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">Each State Party shall ensure effective observation of its entire territory as follows:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">for its mainland territory, Open Skies airfields shall be designated in such a way that no point on its territory is farther from one or more such airfields than 35 per cent of the maximum flight distance or distances established for that State Party in accordance with Annex A to the Treaty;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft46">for portions of its territory that are separated from the mainland territory:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p308 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">that State Party shall apply the provisions of subparagraph</SPAN></P>
<P class="p308 ft3">(A) of this paragraph; or</P>
<P class="p314 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">in the event that the portion or portions of the territory are separated from the mainland territory by more than 600 kilometres, or if agreed between that State Party and the observing Party, or if otherwise provided for in Annex A, that State Party shall provide special procedures, including the possible use of refuelling airfields; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p320 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">in the event that a portion or portions of the territory are separated from the mainland territory by less than 600 kilometres, and such portion or portions of the territory are not covered by</SPAN></P>
<P class="p336 ft3">the provisions of subparagraph</P>
<P class="p337 ft3">(A) of this paragraph, that State Party may specify a separate maximum flight distance in Annex A to cover such portion or portions of its territory.</P>
<P class="p85 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft57">Immediately upon the arrival of an observation aircraft at the point of entry, and immediately prior to the departure of an observation aircraft from the point of exit, both the observed and observing Parties shall inspect the covers for sensor apertures or other devices that inhibit the operation of sensors installed in accordance with Article IV, paragraph 4. In the event that the point of entry is different from the Open Skies airfield from which the observation flight commences, both the observed and observing Parties shall inspect the covers for sensor apertures or other devices that inhibit the operation of sensors immediately prior to departure of the observation aircraft from the point of entry en route to the Open Skies airfield from which the observation flight commences. In the event that the point of exit is different from the Open Skies airfield at which the observation flight terminates, both the observed and observing Parties shall inspect the covers for sensor apertures or other devices that inhibit the operation of sensors immediately prior to departure of the observation aircraft from such airfield en route to the point of exit.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p338 ft31"><SPAN class="ft5">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft85">A State Party shall have the right to conduct an examination and inventory of the items of equipment that the other State Party intends to use for the purpose of conducting a </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of sensors and, if applicable, the observation aircraft, as well as items that the flight repre-</P>
<P class="p139 ft3">89</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_90">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">sentatives intend to bring on board the observation aircraft. This exami-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">nation and inventory:</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">shall begin no later than one hour after arrival of such items at the point of entry or the Open Skies airfield, at the choice of the State Party conducting the inventory, and shall be completed within one hour; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">shall be carried out in the presence of one or more designated individuals of the other State Party.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">If, during the examination and inventory of the items of equipment to be used in the sensor inspection and, if applicable, observation aircraft inspection, as well as the items that the flight representatives intend to bring on board the observation aircraft, the State Party conducting the examination and inventory determines that the items do not conform to the list of authorized equipment contained in Annex D, Section II, paragraph 5, or to the items described in Annex G, Section I, paragraph 4, it shall have the right to deny permission for the use of such items. Items so identified that are brought into the territory of the observed Party by the observing Party shall be, unless otherwise agreed:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">placed in a sealed container for safekeeping; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft46">subsequently removed from the territory of the observed Party at the earliest opportunity, but not later than the departure of the observing Party from the territory of the observed Party.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">9.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">In the event that the observing Party travels to the point of entry specified in the notification provided in accordance with Article VI, Section I, paragraph 5 of this Treaty, using a transport aircraft registered with the observing Party or with another State Party, the transport aircraft shall be permitted:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p175 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft58">to depart from the territory of the observed Party;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">in the event that the point of entry is the same as the point of exit, to remain at the point of entry until departure of the observing Party from the territory of the observed Party; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">in the event that the point of entry is not the same as the point of exit, to fly to the point of exit in sufficient time for further crew rest prior to departure of all the personnel of the observing Party from the territory of the observed Party.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">10.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft44">In the event that the observation aircraft is provided by the observed Party and the observing Party does not use its own transport aircraft for transporting its personnel from the point of entry to the Open Skies airfield, the observed Party shall ensure that the personnel of the observing Party are transported from the point of entry to the Open Skies airfield and from the Open Skies airfield to the point of exit.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p339 ft3">90</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_91">


<P class="p158 ft3">Prop. 2001/02:157</P>
<P class="p158 ft3">Bilaga 6</P>
<P class="p340 ft24">ANNEX E</P>
<P class="p341 ft56">APPENDIX 1</P>
<P class="p125 ft3">SECTION I. DESIGNATION OF SITES</P>
<P class="p80 ft14">The sites to be used as points of entry, points of exit, Open Skies airfields, refuelling airfields, calibration targets, and, if applicable, entry fixes and exit fixes are initially as specified in Section II of this Appendix. The designation includes:</P>
<P class="p342 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft59">Site: name of point of entry, point of exit, Open Skies airfield, entry fix, exit fix, refuelling airfield, and calibration target;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">Location: latitude and longitude of the respective site, to the nearest second; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p174 ft10"><SPAN class="ft3">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft68">Inspection: whether or not the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of the aircraft or the sensors can be conducted at this site.</P>
<P class="p83 ft28">SECTION II. POINTS OF ENTRY, POINTS OF EXIT, OPEN</P>
<P class="p227 ft28">SKIES</P>
