<P class="p401 ft56"><NOBR>PRE-FLIGHT</NOBR> INSPECTIONS AND DEMONSTRATION FLIGHTS</P>
<P class="p402 ft24">SECTION I. <NOBR>PRE-FLIGHT</NOBR> INSPECTION OF OBSERVA-</P>
<P class="p227 ft24">TION AIRCRAFT AND SENSORS OF THE OBSERVING</P>
<P class="p403 ft24">PARTY</P>
<P class="p404 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The purpose of the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of observation aircraft and sensors provided by the observing Party is to confirm that the observation aircraft, its sensors and associated equipment correspond to those certified in accordance with the provisions of Annex D to the Treaty. The observed Party shall have the right to conduct a <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of an observation aircraft and its sensors provided by the observing Party to confirm that:</P>
<P class="p405 ft31">(A) the observation aircraft, its sensors and associated equipment including, where applicable, lens and photographic film, correspond to those certified in accordance with the provisions of Annex D to the Treaty; and</P>
<P class="p22 ft3">(B) there are no items of equipment on board the observation aircraft other than those permitted by Article IV of the Treaty.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Upon arrival of the observation aircraft at the point of entry the observed Party shall:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3">(A) provide a list of the inspectors, the number of whom shall not exceed ten persons, unless otherwise agreed, including the general function of each of the inspectors;</P>
<P class="p22 ft3">(B) provide a list of the items of equipment that they intend to use during the <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection provided for in Annex D, Section II, paragraph 5 to the Treaty; and</P>
<P class="p22 ft14">(C) inform the observing Party of its plan for the <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of the observation aircraft and its sensors.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">Prior to the commencement of the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection, a designated individual from the observing Party shall:</P>
<P class="p22 ft3">(A) brief the observed Party on the inventory procedures which shall be followed to confirm that all inspection equipment, as well as any non- <NOBR>destructive-testing</NOBR> equipment as provided for in paragraph 7 of this Section, brought on board the observation aircraft by the inspectors has been removed from the observation aircraft upon conclusion of the <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection;</P>
<P class="p22 ft3">(B) together with the inspectors, conduct an examination and inventory of each item of equipment to be used during the <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection; and</P>
<P class="p85 ft31">(C) brief the inspectors on all safety precautions that they shall observe during the <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of the observation aircraft and its sensors.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection shall not begin until the completion of the formal arrival procedures and shall take no longer than eight hours.</P>
<P class="p85 ft31"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft85">The observing Party shall have the right to provide its own escorts to accompany the inspectors throughout the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of the observation aircraft and its sensors to confirm that the inspection is conducted in accordance with the provisions of this Section. The observing Par-</P>
<P class="p406 ft3">105</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_106">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">ty shall facilitate the inspection in accordance with the procedures speci-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">fied in Annex D, Section II, paragraphs 7 and 8 to the Treaty.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">In conducting the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection, the inspectors shall have the right of access to the observation aircraft, its sensors and associated equipment, in the same manner as provided for in Annex D, Section II, paragraph 10, and shall comply with the provisions of Annex D, Section II, paragraphs 11 and 12 to the Treaty.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">For the purposes of this inspection, the observed Party shall have the right to take on board and use the following </SPAN><NOBR>non-destructive-testing</NOBR> equipment:</P>
<P class="p88 ft3">(A) video probe (borescope on video camera);</P>
<P class="p88 ft3">(B) <NOBR>X-ray</NOBR> and backscatter <NOBR>X-ray</NOBR> imaging equipment;</P>
<P class="p88 ft3">(C) ultrasonic imaging equipment;</P>
<P class="p88 ft3">(D) logic/data analyser;</P>
<P class="p88 ft3">(E) passive <NOBR>infra-red</NOBR> sensors; and</P>
<P class="p88 ft3">(F) 35 millimetre camera.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3">In addition, the observed Party shall have the right to take on board and use such other <NOBR>non-destructive-testing</NOBR> equipment as may be necessary to establish that no items of equipment are on board the observation aircraft other than those permitted by Article IV of the Treaty, as may be agreed by the Open Skies Consultative Commission prior to 30 June 1992.</P>
<P class="p24 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft48">Upon completion of the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection, the inspectors shall leave the observation aircraft, and the observing Party shall have the right to use its own inventory procedures to confirm that all inspection equipment used during the <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection has been removed from the observation aircraft. If the observed Party is unable to demonstrate this to the satisfaction of the observing Party, the observing Party shall have the right to proceed with the observation flight or to cancel it, and when the observing Party is satisfied that it is safe to do so, depart from the territory of the observed Party. In the latter case, no observation flight shall be recorded against the quota of either State Party.</P>
<P class="p23 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">9.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft57">The inspectors shall immediately inform the observing Party if they establish that the observation aircraft, its sensors or associated equipment do not correspond to those certified in accordance with the provisions of Annex D to the Treaty, or that there are items of equipment on board the observation aircraft other than those permitted by Article IV of the Treaty. If the observing Party is unable to demonstrate that the observation aircraft, its sensors and associated equipment correspond to those certified in accordance with the provisions of Annex D to the Treaty and that there are no items of equipment on board the observation aircraft other than those permitted by Article IV of the Treaty, and if the observing and observed Parties do not agree otherwise, the observed Party shall have the right to prohibit the observation flight pursuant to Article VIII of the Treaty. If the observation flight is prohibited, the observation aircraft shall promptly depart from the territory of the observed Party and no observation flight shall be recorded against the quota of either State Party.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p407 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">10.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft41">Upon completion of the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of the observation aircraft and its sensors, the observed and observing Parties shall prepare a <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection report which shall state that:</P>
<P class="p408 ft3">106</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_107">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">(A) the observation aircraft, its sensors and associated equipment cor-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">respond to those certified in accordance with the provisions of Annex D</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">to the Treaty; and</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">(B) there are no items of equipment on board the observation aircraft</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">other than those permitted by Article IV of the Treaty.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">11. Signature of the <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection report by the observed Party</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft5">shall signify its agreement for the observing Party to use that observation</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft5">aircraft to conduct an observation flight over the territory of the observed</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr8 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Party.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr8 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p79 ft3">SECTION II. PRE FLIGHT INSPECTION OF SENSORS OF THE</P>
<P class="p227 ft3">OBSERVED PARTY</P>
<P class="p193 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The purpose of the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of the sensors on an observation aircraft provided by the observed Party is to confirm that the sensors and associated equipment correspond to those certified in accordance with the provisions of Annex D to the Treaty. The observing Party shall have the right to conduct a <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of the sensors and associated equipment installed on an observation aircraft provided by the observed Party to confirm that its sensors and associated equipment correspond to those certified in accordance with the provisions of Annex D to the Treaty.</P>
<P class="p48 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">Upon arrival of the inspectors of the observing Party at the location of the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection, the observing Party shall:</P>
<P class="p22 ft3">(A) provide a list of the inspectors, the number of whom shall not exceed five persons, unless otherwise agreed, including the general function of each inspector;</P>
<P class="p22 ft14">(B) provide a list of the items of equipment that the inspectors intend to use during the <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection; and</P>
<P class="p22 ft3">(C) inform the observed Party of its plan for the <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of the sensors and associated equipment on board the observation aircraft.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">Prior to the commencement of the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection, a designated individual from the observed Party shall:</P>
<P class="p22 ft3">(A) brief the observing Party on the inventory procedures that shall be followed to confirm that each item of equipment brought on board the observation aircraft by the inspectors has been removed from the observation aircraft upon conclusion of the <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection;</P>
<P class="p22 ft3">(B) together with the inspectors, conduct an examination and inventory of each item of equipment to be used during the <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection; and</P>
<P class="p22 ft3">(C) brief the inspectors on all necessary safety precautions that they must observe during the <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of the sensors and associated equipment installed on the observation aircraft.</P>
<P class="p22 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">The </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection shall not begin until the completion of the formal arrival procedures and shall take no longer than eight hours.</P>
<P class="p85 ft63"><SPAN class="ft63">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft64">The observed Party shall have the right to provide its own escorts to accompany the inspectors throughout the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of the sensors and associated equipment on board the observation aircraft to confirm that the inspection is conducted in accordance with the provisions of</P>
<P class="p409 ft3">107</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_108">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">this Section. The observed Party shall facilitate the inspection of the sen-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">sors and associated equipment on board the observation aircraft by the</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">inspectors in accordance with the procedures specified in Annex D, Sec-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">tion II, paragraph 7 to the Treaty.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">In conducting the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection, the inspectors shall have the right of access to the sensors and associated equipment on board the observation aircraft in the same manner as provided for in Annex D, Section II, paragraph 10 and shall comply with the provisions of Annex D, Section II, paragraphs 11 and 12 to the Treaty.</P>
<P class="p85 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft48">Upon completion of the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection, the inspectors shall leave the observation aircraft and the observed Party shall have the right to use its own inventory procedures to confirm that all items of equipment have been removed from the observation aircraft. If the observing Party is unable to demonstrate this to the satisfaction of the observed Party, the observed Party shall have the right to prohibit the observation flight in accordance with Article VIII of the Treaty, and no observation flight shall be recorded against the quota of either State Party.</P>
<P class="p85 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The inspectors shall immediately inform the observed Party if they establish that any of the sensors or associated equipment on board the observation aircraft do not correspond to those certified in accordance with the provisions of Annex D to the Treaty. If the observed Party is unable to demonstrate that the sensors or associated equipment on board the observation aircraft correspond to those certified in accordance with Annex D to the Treaty, the observing Party shall have the right to:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p410 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">agree to use an alternative package of sensor types or capabilities proposed by the observed Party;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p411 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">proceed according to the original mission plan;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">accept a delay in the commencement of the observation flight to permit the observed Party to rectify the problem determined to exist by the observing Party pursuant to this paragraph. In the event that the problem is resolved to the satisfaction of the observing Party, the flight shall proceed according to the mission plan, revised as necessary due to any delay. In the event that the problem is not rectified to the satisfaction of the observing Party, the observing Party shall depart the territory of the observed Party; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">cancel the observation flight, and immediately depart the territory of the observed Party.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">9.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">If the observing Party leaves the territory of the observed Party not having conducted an observation flight, as provided for in paragraph 8, subparagraphs (C) and (D) of this Section, no observation flight shall be counted against the quota of either State Party.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">10.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">Upon completion of the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection of the sensors and associated equipment installed on the observation aircraft, the observed Party and the observing Party shall prepare a pre flight inspection report that shall state that the sensors correspond to those certified in accordance with the provisions of Annex D to the Treaty. Signature of the preflight inspection report by the observing Party shall signify its agreement to use that observation aircraft to conduct an observation flight over the territory of the observed Party.</P>
<P class="p413 ft3">108</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_109">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p12 ft28">SECTION III. DEMONSTRATION FLIGHTS</P>
<P class="p246 ft3">1. In the event that the aircraft is provided by the observing Party, at the request of the observed Party, the observing Party shall, following the <NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection, conduct a demonstration flight to allow the inspectors to observe the functioning of the sensors that are to be used during the observation flight and to collect sufficient data to allow them to confirm that the capability of those sensors is in accordance with the provisions of Article IV, paragraph 8 of the Treaty.</P>
<P class="p182 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">In the event that the aircraft is provided by the observed Party, at the request of the observing Party, the observed Party shall, following the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection, conduct a demonstration flight to allow the inspectors to observe the functioning of the sensors that are to be used during the observation flight and to collect sufficient data to allow them to confirm that the capability of those sensors is in accordance with the provisions of Article IV, paragraph 9 of the Treaty.</P>
<P class="p40 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">In the event that either the observed or observing Party exercises its right to request a demonstration flight:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p414 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">the demonstration flight shall be performed in accordance with the requirements of Annex D, Section III;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p415 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">the demonstration flight shall last for no more than two hours;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p414 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">the observed Party shall provide calibration targets in accordance with the specifications in Appendix 1 to Annex D to the Treaty in the vicinity of the airfield at which the </SPAN><NOBR>pre-flight</NOBR> inspection is to be conducted;</P>
<P class="p414 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">any delay in carrying out a request for a demonstration flight caused by weather conditions or problems with the aircraft or sensors of the observed Party shall not count against the time allocated for such flights, unless otherwise agreed;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p414 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft89">the observed Party shall process the data collected by sensors at a facility in the vicinity of the airfield at which the pre flight inspection is to be conducted, in the presence of personnel of the observing Party, in accordance with the provisions of Article IX, Sections II and III of the Treaty; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p416 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(F)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft90">the cost of the demonstration flight, including the provision of data recording media and the processing of data, shall be distributed in accordance with the provisions of Annex L, Section I, paragraph 9 to the Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">In the event that the observed Party exercises its right to request a demonstration flight, the observing Party shall have the right to add a period of up to 24 hours to the 96 hours allowed for the conduct of the observation flight, pursuant to Article VI, Section I, paragraph 9. This shall not affect the right of other States Parties to conduct observation flights after the original period of 96 hours as provided for in Article VI, Section I, paragraph 3 of the Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p40 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">In the event that the observing Party exercises its right to request a demonstration flight, this shall be accomplished within the period of 96 hours allowed for the conduct of the observation flight, pursuant to Article VI, Section I, paragraph 9 of the Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft10"><SPAN class="ft5">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">In the event that the observed Party is not satisfied that the capability of any sensor installed on the observation aircraft provided by the ob-</SPAN></P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p12 ft3">Prop. 2001/02:157</P>
<P class="p12 ft3">Bilaga 6</P>
<P class="p396 ft3">109</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_110">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">serving Party is in accordance with the provisions of Article IV, para-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">graph 8 of the Treaty, the observed Party shall have the right to:</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p417 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">in the case of a sensor for which ground resolution is dependent upon height above ground level, propose an alternative minimum height above ground level at which that sensor shall be permitted to be operated during the observation flight;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p418 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">in the case of sensors for which ground resolution is not dependent upon height above ground level, prohibit the operation of that sensor during the observation flight; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p418 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">prohibit the observation flight pursuant to the provisions of Ar- ticle VIII of the Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p419 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">In the event that the observing Party is not satisfied that the capability of any sensor installed on the observation aircraft provided by the observed Party is in accordance with the provisions of Article IV, paragraph 9 of the Treaty, the observing Party shall have the right to:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p418 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">agree to use an alternative package of sensor types or capabilities proposed by the observed Party;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p418 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">in the case of a sensor for which ground resolution is dependent upon height above ground level, propose an alternative minimum height above ground level at which that sensor shall be permitted to be operated during the observation flight;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p418 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">in the case of sensors for which ground resolution is not dependent upon height above ground level, conduct the observation flight as planned, and the cost of the data recording media for that sensor shall be borne by the observed Party;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p417 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft91">accept a delay in the commencement of the observation flight to permit the observed Party to rectify the problem determined to exist by the observing Party. In the event that the problem is resolved to the satisfaction of the observing Party, the flight shall proceed according to the mission plan, revised as necessary due to any delay. In the event that the problem is not rectified to the satisfaction of the observing Party, the observing Party shall depart the territory of the observed Party; or</SPAN></P>
<P class="p418 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft92">cancel the observation flight pursuant to Article VIII of the Treaty, and immediately depart the territory of the observed Party.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p419 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">In the event that the observation flight is prohibited or cancelled by the State Party requesting the demonstration flight, no observation flight shall be counted against the quota of either State Party, and the State Party requesting the demonstration flight shall convey the matter to the Open Skies Consultative Commission.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p420 ft3">110</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_111">


<P class="p421 ft3">Prop. 2001/02:157</P>
<P class="p158 ft3">Bilaga 6</P>
<P class="p422 ft24">ANNEX G</P>
<P class="p423 ft56">FLIGHT MONITORS, FLIGHT REPRESENTATIVES, AND RE-</P>
<P class="p49 ft56">PRESENTATIVES</P>
<P class="p126 ft3">SECTION I. FLIGHT MONITORS AND FLIGHT REPRESENTATI-</P>
<P class="p49 ft3">VES</P>
<P class="p193 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The provisions set forth in this Annex shall apply to personnel designated in accordance with Article XIII. Each State Party shall have the right to have at any one time the number of flight monitors and flight representatives on board the observation aircraft as set forth in Article VI, Section III. The provisions of that Section shall govern their activities with respect to the organization and conduct of observation flights. Each State Party shall facilitate the activities of the flight monitors and flight representatives pursuant to this Annex.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p24 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The observed Party shall appoint one of the flight monitors as chief flight monitor. The chief flight monitor shall be a national of the observed Party. The observing Party shall appoint one of the flight representatives as chief flight representative. The chief flight representative shall be a national of the observing Party.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p24 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">In preparing for the observation flight, flight monitors and flight representatives shall have the right:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">to acquaint themselves with the technical literature relating to the functioning and operation of the sensors and the flight operation manual of the observation aircraft; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">to acquaint themselves with the equipment of the observation aircraft relating to the control of the flight regime and the functioning and operation of the sensors installed on the observation aircraft.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p88 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Flight monitors and flight representatives shall have the right:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft70">to remain on board the observation aircraft throughout the observation flight, including any stops for refuelling or emergencies;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">to bring on board the observation aircraft and use maps, flight charts, publications, and operations manuals;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">to move unencumbered about the observation aircraft, including the flight deck, during the observation flight, except for flight safety reasons. In exercising their rights, the flight monitors or flight representatives shall not interfere with the activities of the flight crew;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">to monitor compliance with the flight plan and to observe the flight regime of the observation aircraft and the functioning and operation of the sensors;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft89">to listen to internal and external radio communications on board the aircraft and to make internal radio communications; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">(F)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft93">to record the parameters of the flight regime and the functioning and operation of the sensors on maps, charts, and note-</SPAN></P>
<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t33">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr8 td77"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">pads.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD rowspan=2 class="tr12 td78"><SPAN class="p13 ft3">111</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr17 td77"><SPAN class="p3 ft33">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_112">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p43 ft3">5. In addition to those rights specified in paragraph 4 of this Section,</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">the chief flight monitor shall have the right:</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">to consult the flight crew regarding compliance with national flight rules and the provisions of the Treaty;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">to observe the activities of the flight crew, including activities on the flight deck, during the observation flight, as well as to monitor the functioning and operation of the flight and navigation instruments of the observation aircraft;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">to provide recommendations to the flight crew regarding compliance with the flight plan;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">to ask the flight crew, without interfering with their activities, for information on the flight regime; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p424 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft94">to communicate with air traffic control authorities, as appropriate, and to help relay and interpret communications from air traffic control authorities to flight crew and from the flight crew to the air traffic control authorities about the conduct of the observation flight; for this purpose, the chief flight monitor shall be permitted to make external radio communications using the radio equipment of the observation aircraft.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p425 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">In the event that the chief flight monitor believes that the observation aircraft is deviating from its flight plan, the chief flight monitor shall advise the flight crew and may inform the air traffic control authorities of any deviations of the observation aircraft from the flight plan that the chief flight monitor believes could threaten flight safety.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p48 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">In addition to the rights specified in paragraph 5 of this Section, the chief flight representative shall have:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">the rights as described in paragraph 5, subparagraphs (A), (B) and (D) of this Section with regard to the flight crew; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">the right, in case of deviation from the flight plan, to receive an explanation from the flight crew as to the reasons for such a deviation.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Flight representatives shall have the right to direct the operation of the sensors during the observation flight. In addition, upon notification to the observed Party prior to the commencement of the observation flight, flight representatives shall have the right to operate the sensors during the observation flight. In the event that the flight representatives exercise their right to operate the sensors pursuant to this paragraph, the observed Party shall not be responsible for any failure or inadequacy in the quality of the data collected by the sensors due to the operation of the sensors by the flight representatives.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p6 ft3">SECTION II. REPRESENTATIVES</P>
<P class="p193 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">An observing Party using an observation aircraft designated by a third State Party shall have the right to have at any one time the number of representatives on board the observation aircraft set forth in Article VI, Section III of the Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p48 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">The observing Party shall appoint one of its representatives as chief representative. The chief representative shall have the rights of the chief</SPAN></P>
<P class="p426 ft3">112</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_113">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">flight representative as specified in Section I of this Annex. In addition,</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">the chief representative shall:</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">advise the </SPAN><NOBR>pilot-in-command</NOBR> regarding compliance with the provisions of the Treaty;</P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">have the right to monitor compliance by the observed Party with the provisions of the Treaty; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">have the right, in case of deviations from the flight plan, to receive an explanation from the </SPAN><NOBR>pilot-in-command</NOBR> as to the reasons for such a deviation.</P>
<P class="p22 ft10"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft9">Representatives shall have the rights of flight representatives as specified in Section I of this Annex.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p427 ft24">ANNEX H</P>
<P class="p428 ft56"><NOBR>CO-ORDINATION</NOBR> OF PLANNED OBSERVATION FLIGHTS</P>
<P class="p332 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft57">In order to avoid potential time conflict regarding the conduct of observation flights over the same State Party, each State Party having the right to conduct observation flights following the annual distribution of active quotas may notify all other States Parties, no later than 1 November of each year, of its plans to utilize all or part of its active quota during the following year. The notification shall indicate the number of observation flights that the notifying State Party plans to conduct over the territory of other States Parties during each quarter of that year.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p48 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">In no case shall the total number of observation flights planned and notified in accordance with paragraph 1 of this Annex over the territory of any one State Party during a given quarter exceed 16. Except as provided for in Article VI, Section I, paragraph 3, no State Party shall be obliged to accept more than one observation flight at any time during the period specified in Article VI, Section I, paragraph 9 of the Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p23 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">States Parties that have notified, in accordance with paragraph 1 of this Annex, their plans to utilize one or more active quotas for observation flights over the territory of the same State Party during a given quarter or quarters shall hold consultations, if necessary, to avoid any conflict in their planned observation flights. In the event that agreement on avoidance of conflict cannot be reached through consultation among the States Parties involved, the issue shall be resolved by the drawing of lots by such States Parties. The first of those consultations, regarding observation flights in the quarter beginning 1 January of the following year, shall begin promptly following receipt of the notification provided for in paragraph 1 of this Annex. Subsequent consultations among the States Parties involved shall be conducted between 1 February and 15 February for the quarter beginning 1 April; between 1 May and 15 May for the quarter beginning 1 July; and between 1 August and 15 August for the quarter beginning 1 October. The States Parties involved shall notify the resulting sequence of observation flights established in these consultations to all States Parties no later than 15 November, 15 February, 15 May and 15 August, respectively.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p429 ft31"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft61">No later than seven days after the notification of the sequence of observation flights established pursuant to paragraph 3 of this Annex, each</SPAN></P>
<P class="p430 ft3">113</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_114">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">State Party shall notify all States Parties planning to conduct observation</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">flights over its territory during that quarter of each flight for which it in-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">tends to exercise the right to provide its own observation aircraft.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p43 ft3">5. Each State Party that has not provided a notification pursuant to pa-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>

	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">ragraph 1 of this Annex or has not notified its plans to utilize all of its</SPAN> </TD>

</TR>

	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>

	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">ter for which it had notified such planned flight, shall have the right to</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">utilize such remaining active quotas, provided that such observation</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">flights have been accommodated within the existing agreement reached</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr8 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">pursuant to paragraph 3 of this Annex.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr8 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p431 ft24">ANNEX I</P>
<P class="p423 ft56">INFORMATION ON AIRSPACE AND FLIGHTS IN HAZARDOUS</P>
<P class="p49 ft56">AIRSPACE</P>
<P class="p432 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">No earlier than 90 days after entry into force of the Treaty, at the request of any other State Party, a State Party shall provide, no later than 30 days after the receipt of such a request, the following information in accordance with ICAO provisions:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">its airspace structure, as published in the Aeronautical Information Publication (AIP) series;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p411 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">detailed information on all hazardous airspace; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">airfield information and arrival and departure procedures for each of its:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p433 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(1)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">points of entry and points of exit;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p433 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(2)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">Open Skies airfields; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p434 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(3)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">alternate airfields and refuelling airfields for its points of entry, points of exit, and Open Skies airfields.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Each State Party shall promptly notify States Parties that have requested information in accordance with the provisions of paragraph 1 of this Annex of any changes to the information provided in accordance with paragraph 1 of this Annex. Notwithstanding the provisions of this paragraph, Notices to Airmen (NOTAMs) need not be provided.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p85 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">No later than 90 days after entry into force of the Treaty, each State Party shall notify all other States Parties of the source of the information to be provided in accordance with paragraph 1 of this Annex.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p435 ft24">ANNEX J</P>
<P class="p436 ft56">MONTREUX CONVENTION</P>
<P class="p178 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">Observation flights conducted under the provisions of the Treaty providing for the observation of the entire territory of States Parties shall not prejudice the Montreux Convention of 20 July 1936.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p85 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">The routing and notification of transit flights of aircraft for the purpose of the Treaty falling within the scope of Article 23 of the Montreux Convention shall be governed by the provisions of that Article.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p437 ft3">114</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_115">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t34">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr16 td79"><SPAN class="p3 ft24">ANNEX K</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr16 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr26 td79"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr26 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft54">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p49 ft56">INFORMATION ON FILM PROCESSORS, DUPLICATORS AND</P>
<P class="p49 ft95">PHOTOGRAPHIC FILMS, AND PROCEDURES FOR MONITO-</P>
<P class="p49 ft56">RING THE PROCESSING OF PHOTOGRAPHIC FILM</P>
<P class="p438 ft3">SECTION I. INFORMATION ON FILM PROCESSORS, DUPLICA-</P>
<P class="p403 ft3">TORS AND PHOTOGRAPHIC FILMS</P>
<P class="p178 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Pursuant to Annex D, Section II, paragraph 3, subparagraph (A) (3) to the Treaty, each State Party, when notifying other States Parties of film processors or duplicators that it intends to use to develop original film negatives or produce duplicate film positives or negatives, shall provide the following manufacturer's information:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p439 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">the processor or duplicator name;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p440 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft96">the maximum and minimum width and length, if applicable, of film which may be processed or duplicated;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">each type of film that may be processed or duplicated in that film processor; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">each step in the process, including the range of exposure, temperature, duration, recommended film transport speed, chemicals and chemical mixes, for each type of film.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p85 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Pursuant to Annex D, Section II, paragraph 3, subparagraph (A) (2) to the Treaty, each State Party, when providing information on the types of black and white aerial film that it intends to use to collect data during the in flight examination or an observation flight, or to duplicate such data, shall provide the following manufacturer's information, for each type of aerial film that may be processed or duplicated by means of the film processors or duplicators referred to in paragraph 1 of this Section, as necessary to confirm the capabilities of the film. Depending upon national practices of the film manufacturer, such information may include:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p411 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">effective film speed;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p411 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">resolution/modulation</SPAN></P>
<P class="p411 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">spectral sensitivity; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p439 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">optical specular density or sensitometric characteristics.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p24 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">For the purposes of determining the sensitometric characteristics of aerial film materials in accordance with its own national methodology, each State Party shall have the right to receive, upon request, unexposed samples of all types of photographic film to be used as data recording media, the chemicals for processing them, and to receive instructions for processing and duplication of such photographic films. Such samples and instructions shall be provided no later than 30 days after receipt of such a request.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p6 ft3">SECTION II. MONITORING OF FILM PROCESSING AND DUPLI-</P>
<P class="p227 ft3">CATION</P>
<P class="p441 ft14">1. States Parties taking part in the certification of an observation aircraft and its sensors shall have the right to monitor the processing and</P>
<P class="p49 ft69">duplication of the aerial film used during the <NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination. Per-</P>
<P class="p430 ft3">115</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_116">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">sonnel of the observed and observing Party shall have the right to moni-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">tor the processing and duplication of the aerial film used during a de-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">monstration and observation flight.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">While monitoring the processing and duplication of aerial film, the States Parties shall have the right to bring with them and use, in a manner that does not disrupt the processing or duplication of the film, the following equipment:</SPAN></P>
<P class="p411 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">(A)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">litmus papers;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p411 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(B)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">thermometers;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p412 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(C)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft65">chemical test equipment, including pH meters and hydrometers;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p411 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(D)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft73">stopwatches;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p411 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(E)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft89">sensitometers;</SPAN></P>
<P class="p411 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(F)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft90">densitometers; and</SPAN></P>
<P class="p411 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">(G)</SPAN><NOBR><SPAN class="ft73">21-step</SPAN></NOBR> sensitometric test strips and optical wedges.</P>
<P class="p85 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft57">Prior to the processing of the films exposed during the </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination, demonstration flight and observation flight, States Parties shall check the film processing equipment and chemicals by processing a <NOBR>21-step</NOBR> sensitometric test strip or exposing and processing a <NOBR>21-step</NOBR> optical wedge to confirm that the sensitometric data for the processing of that type of film using that film process meets the specifications provided pursuant to Section I of this Annex. Unless otherwise agreed, the original or duplicate aerial film negatives or positives shall not be processed or duplicated until the processing of the <NOBR>21-step</NOBR> sensitometric test strip or exposing and processing of the <NOBR>21-step</NOBR> optical wedge meets the characteristics provided in accordance with the provisions of Section I of this Annex for that type of aerial film and film processor or duplicator.</P>
<P class="p333 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Prior to the processing of the films exposed during the </SPAN><NOBR>in-flight</NOBR> examination, demonstration flight and observation flight, States Parties shall have the right to check the film processing equipment and chemicals by exposing and processing a test film of the same type used during the in flight examination, demonstration flight and observation flight to confirm that the washing and fixing process is suitable for the purposes of permanent archive storage.</P>
<P class="p442 ft28">ANNEX L</P>
<P class="p443 ft56">OPEN SKIES CONSULTATIVE COMMISSION</P>
<P class="p126 ft3">SECTION I. GENERAL PROVISIONS</P>
<P class="p84 ft14">Procedures and other provisions relating to the Open Skies Consultative Commission are established in this Annex pursuant to Article X of the Treaty.</P>
<P class="p85 ft3">1. The Open Skies Consultative Commission shall be composed of representatives designated by each State Party. Alternates, advisers and experts of a State Party may take part in the proceedings of the Open Skies Consultative Commission as deemed necessary by that State Party.</P>
<P class="p85 ft5">2. The initial session of the Open Skies Consultative Commission shall open within 60 days of the signature of the Treaty. The Chairman of the</P>
<P class="p49 ft54">opening meeting shall be the representative of Canada.</P>
<P class="p430 ft3">116</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_117">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">3. The Open Skies Consultative Commission shall meet for no fewer</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">than four regular sessions per calendar year unless it decides otherwise.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">Extraordinary sessions shall be convened at the request of one or more</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">States Parties by the Chairman of the Open Skies Consultative Commis-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">sion, who shall promptly inform all other States Parties of the request.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">Such sessions shall open no later than 15 days after receipt of such a re-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p444 ft3">quest by the Chairman.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Sessions of the Open Skies Consultative Commission shall last no longer than four weeks, unless it decides otherwise.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">States Parties shall assume in rotation, determined by alphabetical order in the French language, the chairmanship of the Open Skies Consultative Commission. Each Chairman shall serve from the opening of a session until the opening of the following session, unless otherwise agreed.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">Representatives at meetings shall be seated in alphabetical order of the States Parties in the French language.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p85 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The working languages of the Open Skies Consultative Commission shall be English, French, German, Italian, Russian and Spanish.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The proceedings of the Open Skies Consultative Commission shall be confidential, unless otherwise agreed. The Open Skies Consultative Commission may agree to make its proceedings or decisions public.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">9.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">During the period of provisional application, and prior to 30 June 1992, the Open Skies Consultative Commission shall settle the distribution of costs arising under the Treaty. It shall also settle as soon as possible the scale of distribution for the common expenses associated with the operation of the Open Skies Consultative Commission.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">10.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">During the period of provisional application of the Treaty the Open Skies Consultative Commission shall develop a document relating to notifications and reports required by the Treaty. Such document shall list all such notifications and reports and shall include appropriate formats as necessary.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p24 ft10"><SPAN class="ft5">11.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft68">The Open Skies Consultative Commission shall work out or revise, as necessary, its rules of procedure and working methods.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p235 ft3">SECTION II. ANNUAL REVIEW OF ACTIVE QUOTAS</P>
<P class="p445 ft14">Procedures for the annual review of active quotas as foreseen in Article III, Section I, paragraph 7 of the Treaty shall be as follows:</P>
<P class="p85 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft57">States Parties wishing to modify all or part of the past year's distribution with respect to their active quota shall notify all other States Parties and the Open Skies Consultative Commission, by 1 October of each year, of those States Parties over which they wish to conduct their observation flights during the next calendar year. Such proposed modifications shall be considered by the States Parties during this review, according to the rules set forth in the following paragraphs of this Section.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">If the requests for observation flights over the territory of any given State Party do not exceed its passive quota, then the distribution shall be established as requested, and presented to the Open Skies Consultative Commission for approval.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p446 ft3">117</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_118">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">3. If the requests for observation flights over the territory of any given</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft5">State Party exceed its passive quota, then the distribution shall be establi-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 6</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">shed by general agreement among the interested States Parties, and pre-</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr8 td18"><SPAN class="p447 ft5">sented to the Open Skies Consultative Commission for approval.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr8 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p235 ft3">SECTION III. EXTRAORDINARY OBSERVATION FLIGHTS</P>
<P class="p193 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">The Open Skies Consultative Commission shall consider requests from the bodies of the Conference on Security and </SPAN><NOBR>Co-operation</NOBR> in Europe authorized to deal with respect to conflict prevention and crisis management and from other relevant international organizations to facilitate the organization and conduct of extraordinary observation flights over the territory of a State Party with its consent.</P>
<P class="p24 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">The data resulting from such observation flights shall be made available to the bodies and organizations concerned.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p85 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft57">Notwithstanding any other provision of the Treaty, States Parties may agree on a bilateral and voluntary basis to conduct observation flights over the territory of each other following the procedures regarding the conduct of observation flights. Unless otherwise agreed by the States Parties concerned, the data resulting from such observation flights shall be made available to the Open Skies Consultative Commission.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">Observation flights conducted under the provisions of this Section shall not be counted against the active or passive quotas of the States Parties involved.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p165 ft3">SECTION IV. ADDITIONAL FIELDS FOR THE USE OF THE OPEN</P>
<P class="p227 ft3">SKIES REGIME</P>
<P class="p193 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">States Parties may raise for consideration in the Open Skies Consultative Commission proposals for the use of the Open Skies regime in additional specific fields, such as the environment.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p85 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft42">The Open Skies Consultative Commission may take decisions on such proposals or, if necessary, may refer them to the first and subsequent conferences called to review the implementation of the Treaty, in accordance with the provisions of Article XVI, paragraph 3 of the Treaty.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p448 ft3">118</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_119">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p12 ft1">Fördrag om observationsflygningar</P>
<P class="p148 ft3">De stater som har slutit detta fördrag, nedan kallade <SPAN class="ft4">parterna</SPAN>,</P>
<P class="p40 ft3">som erinrar om de åtaganden de gjorde vid konferensen för säkerhet och samarbete i Europa för att skapa större öppenhet och begriplighet i sin militära verksamhet och för att öka säkerheten genom förtroende- och säkerhetsskapande åtgärder,</P>
<P class="p41 ft14">som välkomnar de historiska tilldragelser i Europa som har förändrat säkerhetsläget från Vancouver till Vladivostok,</P>
<P class="p41 ft3">som önskar bidra med ytterligare utveckling och förstärkning av fred, stabilitet och säkerhet genom samarbete inom detta område genom att skapa ett system för observationsflygningar,</P>
<P class="p41 ft3">som värdesätter det potentiella bidrag som de principer för flygobservationer av detta slag skulle kunna göra för säkerheten och stabiliteten också inom andra regioner,</P>
<P class="p41 ft3">som beaktar möjligheten att tillämpa sådana principer för att förbättra öppenhet och begriplighet, för att möjliggöra övervakning av uppfyllelsen av nuvarande och framtida avtal om rustningskontroll samt för att stärka förmågan att förebygga konflikter och hantera kriser inom ramen för konferensen om säkerhet och samarbete i Europa och inom andra berörda internationella organ,</P>
<P class="p41 ft14">som emotser en möjlighet att utvidga principen om observationsflygningar till att omfatta ytterligare områden såsom miljöskydd,</P>
<P class="p41 ft3">som strävar efter att upprätta förfaranden för att möjliggöra observation från luften av parternas samtliga territorier i avsikt att observera en part eller en partsgrupp på grundval av jämlikhet och effektivitet med bibehållen flygsäkerhet,</P>
<P class="p41 ft14">som beaktar att driften av ett sådant system inte skall vara till förfång för utanförstående stater,</P>
<P class="p28 ft3">har slutit följande fördrag:</P>
<P class="p96 ft30">Artikel I Allmänna bestämmelser</P>
<P class="p449 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft41">Detta fördrag inför det s.k. Open </SPAN><NOBR>Skies-systemet</NOBR> för parternas genomförande av observationsflygningar över varandras territorier och fastställer deras rättigheter och skyldigheter i detta hänseende.</P>
<P class="p129 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">Bilagorna med tillägg utgör en integrerande del av fördraget.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p96 ft30">Artikel II Definitioner</P>
<P class="p116 ft3">I detta fördrag används följande definitioner.</P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">observerad part: </SPAN>part eller partsgrupp över vilkens territorium observationsflygningar genomförs eller avses genomföras räknat från den tidpunkt då den mottar meddelande därom från en observerande part tills de åtgärder vidtagits som hänför sig till flygningen eller till personal som agerar å partens eller partsgruppens vägnar.</P>
<P class="p450 ft31"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft98">observerande part: </SPAN>part eller partsgrupp som avser genomföra eller håller på att genomföra en observationsflygning över en annan parts eller partsgrupps territorium räknat från den tidpunkt då den lämnar medde-</P>
<P class="p12 ft3">lande om sin avsikt att genomföra en observationsflygning tills de åtgär-</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="id_2">
<P class="p12 ft3">Prop. 2001/02:157</P>
<P class="p12 ft3">Bilaga 7</P>
<P class="p396 ft3">119</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_120">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr9 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">der har vidtagits som hänför sig till flygningen eller till personal som</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr9 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">agerar å partens eller partsgruppens vägnar.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 7</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft99">partsgrupp: </SPAN>två eller flera parter som har kommit överens om att bilda en grupp som avses i detta fördrag.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft99">observationsflygplan: </SPAN>ett obeväpnat fastvingeflygplan som utsetts att utföra observationsflygningar, som är registrerat av en parts behöriga myndigheter och som är utrustat med överenskomna sensorer. Med termen obeväpnad menas att observationsflygplan som används i de syften som avses i detta fördrag inte är utrustade för att bära eller bruka vapen.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">observationsflygning: </SPAN>flygning med observationsflygplan av en observerande part över en observerad parts territorium enligt färdplanen från ankomstplatsen eller Open <NOBR>Skies-flygplatsen</NOBR> <NOBR>(OS-flygplatsen)</NOBR> till avgångsplatsen eller <NOBR>OS-flygplatsen.</NOBR></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">transitflygning: </SPAN>flygning med ett observations- eller transportflygplan genomförd av en observerande part eller på dess uppdrag över en tredje parts territorium på väg till eller från den observerade partens territorium.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft99">transportflygplan: </SPAN>annat flygplan än ett observationsflygplan som på uppdrag av den observerande parten genomför flygningar till eller från en observerad parts territorium uteslutande i de syften som avses i detta fördrag.</P>
<P class="p22 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft101">territorium: </SPAN>land innefattande öar samt vatten inom och utom landets gränser, över vilka en part har suveränitet.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">9.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">passiv kvot: </SPAN>det antal observationsflygningar som varje part är skyldig att godta som observerad part.</P>
<P class="p22 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">10.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft102">aktiv kvot: </SPAN>det antal observationsflygningar som varje part har rätt att genomföra som observerande part.</P>
<P class="p85 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">11.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft99">maximal flygsträcka: </SPAN>längsta sträcka över den observerade partens territorium från den punkt vid vilken en observationsflygning får utgå till den punkt vid vilken den får avslutas, vilket närmare anges i bilaga A.</P>
<P class="p88 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">12.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft103">sensor: </SPAN>utrustning av en kategori som anges i artikel IV.1 monterad</P>
<P class="p311 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">i</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">ett observationsflygplan för användning vid observationsflygningar.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">13.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">markupplösning: </SPAN>det minsta avstånd på marken mellan två närbelägna föremål som kan urskiljas som separata föremål.</P>
<P class="p22 ft4"><SPAN class="ft5">14.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">utrustning för infraröd linjeavsökare (IRLS): </SPAN><SPAN class="ft3">sensor som kan ta emot och visa termisk elektromagnetisk strålning som, i den osynliga infraröda delen av det optiska spektrumet, avges av föremål på grund av deras temperatur och i avsaknad av artificiell belysning.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">15.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft104">observationsperiod: </SPAN>angiven tid under en observationsflygning då en särskild i observationsflygplanet monterad sensor är igång.</P>
<P class="p85 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">16.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft105">besättning: </SPAN>personer från en part i vilken, om parten så bestämmer, kan ingå tolkar och som utför uppgifter som är kopplade till ett observationsflygplans eller ett transportflygplans drift eller underhåll.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">17.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft99">besättningschef: </SPAN>den pilot ombord på ett observationsflygplan som är ansvarig för flygplanets verksamhet, färdplanens genomförande och flygplanets säkerhet.</P>
<P class="p22 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">18.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft106">flygövervakare: </SPAN>en person som på uppdrag av den observerade parten befinner sig ombord på ett observationsflygplan tillhandahållet av den observerande parten under en observationsflygning och som utför uppgifter i enlighet med bilaga G.</P>
<P class="p392 ft3">120</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_121">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">19. <SPAN class="ft4">flygrepresentant: </SPAN>en person som på uppdrag av den observerande</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">parten befinner sig ombord på ett observationsflygplan tillhandahållet av</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 7</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr6 td18"><SPAN class="p75 ft3">den observerade parten under en observationsflygning och som utför</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr6 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p451 ft5">uppgifter i enlighet med bilaga G.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft2">&nbsp;</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">20.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">representant: </SPAN>en person utsedd av den observerande parten, som utför uppgifter på dennas uppdrag i enlighet med bilaga G under en observationsflygning ombord på ett observationsflygplan utsett av annan part än den observerande eller observerade parten.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">21.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft99">sensoroperatör: </SPAN>en person från en part som utför uppgifter som är kopplade till funktionen, driften och underhållet av ett observationsflygplans sensorer.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">22.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">inspektör: </SPAN>en person från en part som inspekterar en annan parts sensorer eller observationsflygplan.</P>
<P class="p88 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">23.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft103">eskort: </SPAN>en person från en part som medföljer en annan parts inspek-</P>
<P class="p311 ft3">törer.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">24.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">uppdragsplan: </SPAN>en handling upprättad i ett av rådgivande kommittén fastställt format framlagd av den observerande parten och innehållande uppgifter om färdväg, flygprofil, genomförandeorder samt det stöd som behövs för att genomföra observationsflygningen och som skall avtalas med den observerade parten och utgöra grunden för uppgörandet av färdplanen.</P>
<P class="p24 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">25.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">färdplan: </SPAN>en handling upprättad med stöd av den avtalade uppdragsplanen och i det format och med det innehåll som anges av Internationella civila luftfartsorganisationen, nedan kallad ICAO, och som inges till flygtrafikledningen och utgör grunden för genomförandet av en observationsflygning.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">26.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">uppdragsrapport: </SPAN>en handling upprättad i ett format fastställt av rådgivande kommittén som beskriver en observationsflygning och färdigställs efter flygningens genomförande av den observerande parten och undertecknas av den observerande och den observerade parten.</P>
<P class="p22 ft107"><SPAN class="ft5">27.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft102">Open </SPAN><NOBR>Skies-flygfält</NOBR> <NOBR>(OS-flygfält):</NOBR> <SPAN class="ft14">flygfält utsett av den observerade parten som en punkt på vilken en observationsflygning får börja eller sluta.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">28.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft99">ankomstplats: </SPAN>en plats angiven av den observerade parten för mottagande av den observerande partens personal till den observerade partens territorium.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">29.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">avgångsplats: </SPAN>en plats angiven av den observerade parten för avfärd för den observerande partens personal från den observerade partens territorium.</P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">30.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft100">flygfält för tankning: </SPAN>ett flygfält utsett av den observerade parten för tankning och underhåll av observationsflygplan och transportflygplan.</P>
<P class="p22 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">31.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft106">alternativt flygfält: </SPAN>ett flygfält angivet i färdplanen till vilket ett observationsflygplan eller ett transportflygplan får fortsätta när det anses olämpligt att landa på det avsedda flygfältet.</P>
<P class="p85 ft5"><SPAN class="ft5">32.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft108">farligt luftrum: </SPAN>de skyddsområden, restriktionsområden och farliga områden som definieras i bilaga 2 till konventionen angående internationell civil luftfart är fastställda i enlighet med bilaga 15 till den konventionen för att trygga flygsäkerhet, allmän säkerhet och miljöskydd och om vilka information lämnas i enlighet med <NOBR>ICAO-bestämmelserna.</NOBR></P>
<P class="p452 ft3">121</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_122">


<TABLE cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 class="t5">
<TR>
	<TD class="tr5 td18"><SPAN class="p43 ft3">33. <SPAN class="ft4">skyddsområde: </SPAN>luftrum med definierad avgränsning över en parts</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr5 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft5">Prop. 2001/02:157</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
<TR>
	<TD class="tr7 td18"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">territorium inom vilket flygtrafik är förbjuden.</SPAN> </TD>
	<TD class="tr7 td15"><SPAN class="p3 ft3">Bilaga 7</SPAN> </TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">34.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft97">restriktionsområde: </SPAN>luftrum med definierad avgränsning över en parts territorium inom vilket flygtrafik är begränsad på angivna villkor.</P>
<P class="p22 ft10"><SPAN class="ft5">35.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft109">farligt område: </SPAN>luftrum med definierad avgränsning inom vilket verksamhet som är farlig för flygtrafik kan förekomma vid angivna tider.</P>
<P class="p89 ft30">Artikel III Kvoter</P>
<P class="p21 ft30">Del I Allmänna bestämmelser</P>
<P class="p193 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft44">Varje part skall ha rätt att genomföra observationsflygningar i enlighet med bestämmelserna i detta fördrag.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">2.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Varje part måste gå med på observationsflygningar över sitt territorium i enlighet med bestämmelserna i detta fördrag.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">3.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Varje part skall ha rätt att genomföra lika många observationsflygningar över vilken annan parts territorium som helst som denna andra stat har rätt att genomföra över den själv.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">4.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft66">Det totala antalet observationsflygningar som varje enskild part måste gå med på över sitt eget territorium är lika med denna parts totala passiva kvot. Tilldelning av totala passiva kvoter till parterna anges i bilaga A del I.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">5.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Det antal observationsflygningar som varje enskild part skall ha rätt att genomföra varje år över de övriga parternas territorier är lika med partens individuella, aktiva kvot med avseende på respektive part. En parts totala aktiva kvot är lika med summan av dess individuella aktiva kvoter. En parts totala aktiva kvot skall inte överstiga dess totala passiva kvot.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p453 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">6.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">Den första tilldelningen av aktiva kvoter anges i bilaga A del II.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">7.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">När fördraget trätt i kraft, skall tilldelningen av aktiva kvoter vara föremål för en årlig översyn avseende nästkommande kalenderår inom ramen för rådgivande kommittén. Om det inte är möjligt att under den årliga översynen nå en överenskommelse inom tre veckor om tilldelningen av aktiva kvoter för en viss part, skall den föregående årstilldelningen av aktiva kvoter för denna part kvarstå oförändrad.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft14"><SPAN class="ft5">8.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft44">Utom vad som gäller enligt bestämmelserna i artikel VIII, skall varje observationsflygning som genomförs av en part avräknas mot partens individuella och totala aktiva kvoter.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">9.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Oaktat bestämmelserna i punkt 3 och 5 i denna del, får en part som tilldelats en aktiv kvot, efter överenskommelse med den part över vilken man avser flyga, helt eller delvis föra över sin aktiva kvot till andra parter; parten skall då omedelbart underrätta alla andra parter och rådgivande kommittén. Punkt 10 nedan skall då tillämpas.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">10.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft32">Ingen part får genomföra fler observationsflygningar över en annan parts territorium än vad som motsvarar 50 procent avrundat uppåt till närmaste heltal av sin egen totala aktiva kvot eller av den andra partens totala passiva kvot, vilketdera som är det lägre talet.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p22 ft10"><SPAN class="ft5">11.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft50">Maximala flygsträckor för observationsflygningar över parternas territorier anges i bilaga A del III.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p437 ft3">122</P>
</DIV>
<DIV id="page_123">


<DIV>
<DIV id="id_1">
<P class="p12 ft30">Del II Bestämmelser för partsgrupper</P>
<P class="p454 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">1.</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">a) Utan att det skall inverka på parternas rättigheter och skyldigheter</SPAN></P>
<P class="p455 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">i</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">detta fördrag, kan två eller flera parter som har kvoter bilda en partsgrupp vid fördragets undertecknade eller senare. För en partsgrupp som bildas efter fördragets undertecknande, skall bestämmelserna i denna del börja gälla tidigast sex månader efter det att samtliga andra parter har meddelats och i enlighet med bestämmelserna i punkt 6 nedan.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft14"><SPAN class="ft3">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft44">En partsgrupp skall samverka i fråga om aktiva och passiva kvoter i enlighet med bestämmelserna i punkt 2 eller 3 nedan.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft3">2. a) Medlemmarna i en partsgrupp skall ha rätt att omfördela sina aktiva kvoter inom gruppen avseende ett pågående år allt medan de bibehåller sina individuella passiva kvoter. Meddelande om omfördelningen skall omedelbart göras till alla berörda tredje parter.</P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">En observationsflygning skall räknas som lika många observationsflygningar - och avräknas mot de individuella och totala aktiva kvoterna för den observerande parten - som observerade parter som tillhör gruppen som överflygs. Observationsflygningen skall räknas som en observationsflygning som skall dras av från den totala passiva kvoten för varje observerad part.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p40 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">c)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">Varje part med avseende på vilken en eller flera medlemmar av en partsgrupp har aktiva kvoter skall ha rätt att genomföra 50 procent fler observationsflygningar, avrundat uppåt till närmaste heltal, över samtliga medlemmar i gruppen än sin individuella aktiva kvot med avseende på denna gruppmedlem eller att genomföra två sådana överflygningar, när den inte har någon aktiv kvot i förhållande till den gruppmedlemmen.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">d)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft43">Om den berörda parten utövar denna rätt, skall den minska sin aktiva kvot i förhållande till andra gruppmedlemmar så att summan av observationsflygningar som genomförs över deras territorier inte överstiger summan av de individuella kvoter som parten har i förhållande till alla andra gruppmedlemmar under pågående år.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p182 ft3"><SPAN class="ft5">e)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft7">De maximala flygsträckorna för observationsflygningar över varje gruppmedlems territorium skall gälla. När en observationsflygning genomförs över flera medlemmars territorier, skall, då en medlems maximala flygsträcka uppnåtts, alla sensorer stängas av till dess att observationsflygplanet nått den punkt över nästa gruppmedlems territorium där observationsflygningen avses inledas. För den fortsatta observationsflygningen skall den maximala flygsträcka gälla som hänför sig till det OS- flygfält som ligger närmast denna punkt.</SPAN></P>
<P class="p41 ft14">3. a) En partsgrupp skall på begäran ha rätt till en gemensam total passiv kvot som skall tilldelas den; gemensamma individuella och totala aktiva kvoter skall fördelas i förhållande till denna kvot.</P>
<P class="p41 ft3"><SPAN class="ft3">b)</SPAN><SPAN class="ft40">I detta fall är den totala passiva kvoten lika med det totala antalet observationsflygningar som partsgruppen är skyldig att gå med på varje år. Den totala aktiva kvoten är summan av det antal observationsflygningar som partsgruppen har rätt att genomföra varje år. Dess totala aktiva kvot skall inte överstiga den totala passiva kvoten.</SPAN></P>
